loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en: Bernadette is 23 years old. She is engaged to a businessman. She owns a bar and has been running the bar for the past four years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beer and soda to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: To buy more beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 31 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Luis no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Mecánica.
Por iniciativa propia, Luis trabaja como ayudante en una carpintería, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Luis se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada mejorara su vivienda, ya que desea reforzar el techado y paredes de su hogar, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Luis is a 31-year-old single man living with his parents and siblings in the city of Chincha.  He’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who focuses all his efforts into getting ahead.  Sadly, due to the lack of resources and because he needed to start to work, Luis was unable to study the career of Mechanical Engineering.

On his own initiative, Luis works as a helper in a carpentry shop.  He works every day for about 10 hours daily and believes he does well because of his dedication and effort.

Luis is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help provided he will improve his house since he wants to repair the roof and walls of his house so that he can continue working and striving towards reaching his great dream of owning a house of his own.

loans.use: to repair his roof and walls.

loans.name: Lee Johan

texts.es:
Lee es un hombre de 21 años, vive en a ciudad de Chincha con su esposa y sus tres pequeños hijos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Lee no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Contabilidad que desea.
Por iniciativa propia, Lee trabaja como obrero en una empresa que brinda mantenimiento a maquinas de huevos, adicionalmente en la noches trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Lee se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada mejorara una vivienda, ya que desea construir una habitación para sus hijos, así pues Lee seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograra su gran sueño de terminar la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Lee’s a 21-year-old man living in the city of Chincha with his wife and three little children.  He’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic man who focuses all his efforts into moving his family forward.  Sadly, due to the lack of resources and because he needed to start working, Lee has been unable to study the professional Accounting career he’d like to.

On his own initiative, Lee works as a laborer in a firm that provides maintenance to egg-processing machinery.   In addition, he works nights as a mototaxi driver.  He works every day for about 12 hours and believes he does well because of his dedication and effort.

Lee’s very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will be able to improve his home since he wants to build a bedroom for his children and thus Lee will continue working and striving towards reaching his great dream of finishing building his house.

loans.use: to build a bedroom for his children.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a single Iraqi youth client who is 19 years old and lives with his parents and his three brothers. Ahmad is the eldest, and takes the responsibility of helping his father provide for the family's living while his brothers continue their studies. 

Ahmad works extra hours in his general store; he sells plumber tools, light bulbs, and other basic needs of a house. He has been in this field since 2011 and through practice he gained good experience. Ahmad became well-known in his surroundings due to his competitive prices.

Ahmad is requesting a youth loan of 3,000 USD. He will use this loan to pay the annual rent of his general store and to increase his inventory. 

He believes this loan will improve his business, increase his profits, and will give him the ability to provide himself a promising career with a strong basis.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his general store and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Fouras

texts.en:
Fouras is from Iraq. He is 32 years old and lives in a house with his two bothers. All of them take part in providing the family income.

Fouras owns a shop, where he sells batteries for vehicles. He not only sells, but also changes and installs the batteries. He established his business in 2005, having observed that his neighborhood lacked this kind of service. Since Fouras is the only person with such a profession in the area, he gained an excellent reputation and became well-known to many.

Fouras is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD. He will use this loan to renovate his shop and to buy more batteries to sell. Fouras is aiming to grow more in this field, and to provide more services for his neighborhood. By doing this, he may increase his profits and enhance his current financial conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and to buy more batteries to sell

loans.name: Murtada

texts.en:
Murtada is a 22-year-old married youth client from Iraq.

Murtada is a barber and owns a barber shop. He established his business in 2010, and through practice he has mastered this field. He has an excellent reputation and is well known in the neighborhood. 

Murtada is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to renovate his barber shop, buy a new air conditioner, and an extra hair-cutting chair. 

Murtada is a very ambitious person; he is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may be able to provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: to renovate his barber shop, buy a new air conditioner, and an extra hair-cutting chair

loans.name: Félicia

texts.fr:
Félicia est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier Djifa Kpota à Lomé. Elle est coiffeuse depuis 2008. En 2010, pour augmenter ses revenus, elle associe à son activité la vente ambulante de vêtements pour enfants au marché d’Akodessewa et dans le quartier de Bè. 
Pour satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle et diversifier ses produits, Félicia sollicite un crédit pour acheter des savons et des produits de beauté.
texts.en:
Félicia is married with four children. She lives with her family in the district of Djifa Kpota in Lomé. She became a hairstylist in 2008. 

In 2010, she started to sell children’s clothing as an itinerant vendor at the market of Akodessewa and in the district of Bè in an effort to bolster her income.

To diversify her merchandise and achieve customer satisfaction, Félicia is seeking a loan to buy soaps and beauty products.

loans.use: to buy 30 units of perfume for resale.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan tiene 56 años de vivir en la comunidad, él se dedica a la agricultura actividad que desempeña desde los 15 años de edad, el vive con su esposa y 1 hijo, ya que las 2 señoritas mantienen sus familias aparte, las tierras que trabaja se encuentran a 5 km de distancia, para llegar a donde están las tierras que él trabaja lo hace en caballo, el horario de trabajo es de 6 de la mañana hasta las 12:00 del día. Por la tarde se dedica a sus actividades personales. 

El cliente tiene 41 años de ejercer la actividad de la agricultura, posee mucha experiencia en el cultivo de maíz y frijol; además esta actividad se la enseño su difunto padre,  y él se la ha enseñado a su hijo, y también a sus hijas. 

El crédito lo solicita es para la adquisición de insumos como pesticidas, fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra para terminar la siembra de 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, las cuales esta cultivando en tierra propia.  

 Sueña con poder ampliar su vivienda para dejar una buena herencia a sus hijos, además desea comprar un carro para desarrollar mejor sus actividades agrícolas.
texts.en:
Juan has lived in the community for 36 years.  He has been farming ever since he was 15 years old.  He lives with his wife and one son because the two daughters live with their families independently.  The land that he works is five kilometers away.  In order to get to the land that he works he goes by horse.  His work schedule is from six in the morning until twelve noon.  In the afternoon he takes care of his personal activities.

He has been farming for 41 years.  He has a lot of experience growing corn and beans.  His deceased father taught him this business activity, and he has taught it to his son as well as his daughters.

He is requesting the loan to get supplies like pesticides and fertilizer and to pay for the labor to finish planting 7,000 square meters of corn.  He grows the corn on his own land.

He dreams of being able to expand his house in order to leave a good inheritance to his children.  He also wishes to buy a car in order to better develop his farming activities.

loans.use: to get supplies like pesticides and fertilizer and to pay for the labor to finish planting 7,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Hasanjon

texts.ru: Хасанчон молодой житель Яванского района. Ему 26 лет, имеет среднее образование. Он женат и отец одного ребенка. Хасанчон в данное время является безработным. Он просит кредит чтобы купить машину и начать собственный бизнес по предоставлению услуги такси. Его сбережение составляет 21000 рублей, высланных ему братом, работающим мигрантом в России. Хасанчон планирует работать по маршрутной линии район Яван - город Душанбе. В среднем за день он будет совершать два рейса. Благодаря кредиту у Хасанчон будет собственная работа с хорошим доходом. Кредит он будет погашать за счет прибыли с деятельности.
texts.en: Hasanjon is a young resident of the Yavan district.  He is 26 years old and has a secondary education.  He is married and a father of one child.  Currently, Hasanjon is unemployed.  He is requesting this loan to buy a car and start his own business of providing a taxi service.  His savings amount to 21000 rubles, sent to him by his brother, who is a migrant worker in Russia.  Hasanjon plans to work along the Yavan district - Dushanbe route.  He will make two trips on average.  Thanks to this loan, Hasanjon will have a job with a good income.  He will repay the loan with the profit from his business.

loans.use: to buy a car and start his own business of providing a taxi service

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.ru:
Зебинисо прекрасная мать двоих детей. Развод с мужем не сломал ее и она двигается вперед. Она живет с детьми в районе Пяндж. Ей 37 лет. Она разводит мелкий рогатый скот для продажи. У нее большой опыт в этой сфере. Более 10 лет Зебинисо занимается куплей и продажей овец. Она одна без помощи мужа обеспечивает семью. 
В данный момент Зебиносо просит кредит, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота и от их прибыли расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en: Zebiniso is a beautiful mother of two children.  Divorce from her husband did not break her and she is moving ahead.  She lives with her children in the Pyandj district.  She is 37 years old.  She breeds small livestock for sale.  She has a lot of experience in this field.  Zebiniso has been involved in buying and selling sheep for over ten years.  She is supporting the family without a husband.  Currently, Zebiniso is requesting a loan to increase livestock headcount and then use the profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy small livestock

loans.name: Danaya (La Confiance) Group

texts.fr:
Danaya est un regroupement de 9 femmes du quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de Koutiala qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 3 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les fruits, les habits, les chaussures, de la restauration, etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de groupe. 
Badiallo  est un membre du groupe Danaya assise en 3 eme position de la droite vers la gauche.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  des habits de  toutes sortes. Elle se procure de ces articles  à Koutiala et effectue ses ventes en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Danaya comptent réaliser un bénéfice  moyen de 103 330CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Badiallo  compte réaliser  120 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcée ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
NB/ Oumou est absente de la photo pour raison sociale
texts.en:
Danaya is a group of 9 women from the Hamdallaya neighborhood in the town of Koutiala who live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They are on average 30 years old, married and have at least 3 children.

This group of women sells a variety of items such as fruit, clothing, shoes, catering, etc.

To increase the size of their businesses, the members decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their sixth group loan.

Badiallo is a member of the group Danaya sitting in the 3rd position from the right to the left.

She plans to use her loan to buy all sorts of clothing. She gets her items in Koutiala and sells retail and for cash from home and at the market to a diverse clientele.

While the other members of Danaya group plan to make an average profit of 103,330 FCFA each during this loan cycle, Madam Badiallo plans to make 120,000 FCFA.

In addition to paying back the loans, they use part of the revenue to take care of their personal expenses and increase their working capital.

They hope to see this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso strengthened so that their stock is not scarce.

NB: Oumou is missing from the photo due to social reasons.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 38 años de edad , está casado y tiene 03 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. El trabajo de Juan consiste en la venta de plátanos, Yucas y otros productos que cultiva en su terreno agrícola, durante mucho tiempo sufrió algunos contratiempos en su vida por el terrorismo que golpeaba la ciudad y no tenía un ingreso propio de dinero para su casa, es por eso que desde hace un 12 años decidió empezar un nuevo proyecto sembrando los productos alternativos que dio el gobierno que son cacao, café, plátano entre otros. También cuando esta en su casa se dedica a la venta de distintas bebidas gasificadas de distintos sabores. Le gusta lo que hace, pues le permite tener tiempo para poder estar al cuidado de su vivienda, además que desde que empezó con su negocio le está yendo bien en su economía, ya que tienen dos ingresos para su hogar, desea seguir creciendo, por eso tiene en mente ampliar sus ventas. Por Tanto éste es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de S/.1000 soles, comprará abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Juan, 38, is married with three children living with him in his own house.  Juan’s work consists in selling bananas, manioc and other products he grows on his farmland.  

For a long time he suffered many reverses in life because of the terrorism that assailed the city and he didn’t have a source of income of his own for his house.  Because of this, about 12 years ago he started a new project growing alternative products that the government provided such as cocoa beans, coffee, bananas and others.  Also, when he’s home he sells assorted, various flavored carbonated beverages.  He likes what he does because it gives him time to care for his house and since he started his business he’s been doing well economically because he now has two sources of household income.

He wants to continue growing which is why he’s thinking about increasing his sales.  Therefore, this is his first Kiva loan and he feels grateful for the support he gets to continue forward; he also commits to make his payments punctually.  He will use the requested 1,000 soles to buy organic manure for his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Even though Eunice  grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for herself and her family. Currently, Eunice is a baker. She makes and sells doughnuts in the town of Ankyenyin. Her business has grown substantially since she began seven years ago. She uses her income to help her husband raise their five children. Eunice believes that demand among customers for her doughnuts is very strong, but she is unable to meet their needs due to a limited inventory. Thus she has requested a loan to buy bags of flour so she can bake more donuts. With the new profits from her expanded business, Eunice wants to ensure that all of children can escape poverty and have a better life.

loans.use: to buy flour to use making donuts.

loans.name: Atiqa

texts.en:
Atiqa belongs to an ultra-poor family. She got married five years ago. At the time, her newly married husband did not have any occupation to afford the responsibility of a single family. 

Then she contacted BRAC Pakistan for financial support. She took the first loan for her husband and he started a blacksmith business and was given standing in his family. He has purchased a welding plant and welding tools and has been establishing his business with the help of previous loans. 

Now, her husband wants to buy a lathe machine with the contribution of his savings and some depreciated tools. Therefore, Atiqa requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, who is the active field partner of Kiva, so that her husband would be able to buy the lathe machine.

loans.use: to buy a lathe machine.

loans.name: Sua'ad

texts.en:
Sua’ad is a 37-year-old, married mother of four children. She has a beauty salon, and she has been working in this sector since 2009. Her salon is located in a highly-populated region, which is a good location to develop her business and work on increasing her income.

Sua’ad asked Ryada for this loan, to enable her to buy a power generator, a stand on which to display beauty products, and new chairs for the customers.

loans.use: to buy a power generator, a stand on which to display beauty products, and new chairs for the customers.

loans.name: Angela Danila

texts.es: Doña Ángela es originaria de la ciudad de León. De 47 años de edad y madre soltera de una hija. Es de oficio comerciante, dueña de una panadería, la cual fue heredada por su mama. Tiene como apoyo a su hija y hermana quienes le ayudan con la elaboración de panes. Solicita el crédito para comprar productos como: harina, aceite, levadura y azúcar con el fin de satisfacer a sus clientes y aumentar sus ventas  e ingresos. Su plan próximo es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio ya que es pequeño. Su meta futuro es comprar una camioneta para distribuir en mayor cantidad su producto.
texts.en:
Ángela is from the city of León.  She’s 47-years-old and the single mother of a daughter.  She’s a merchant by profession.  She owns a bakery that she inherited from her mother.  Her daughter and her sister help her bake the bread.

She’s requesting the loan to buy such products as flour, oil, yeast and sugar to meet customer demand and increase sales and profits.  Her next plan is to improve the business’ infrastructure because it’s small.  Her future goal is to buy a pick-up truck to distribute her product in larger amounts.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, yeast and sugar.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is married and has three children. Two of her children go to school. She also takes care of another family member (her father).  She has a restaurant business, which she has had for one year. 

Milly has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO. She will use the loan to buy more bunches of green bananas, maize flour, cassava, rice, beef and fresh fish.  She works at the market, six days out of every week.   Her major business challenges include customers who buy on credit and then default, and the rainy season, which hinders her customers from reaching out to her.

She aspires to own a fully-stocked restaurant and to build her own house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas, maize flour, cassava, rice, beef and fresh fish, to serve at her restaurant

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is a 23-year-old single man from a small village near Tulkarem. He lives with his family in a small house in his village. For the past five years, Omar has been been in the business of distributing cooking gas to houses in the city. He owns a number of containers which he fills with gas before renting them to customers. He would like to improve his business and expand it to serve as many people as he can. To make this possible, he has taken out a loan from FATEN to buy more gas jars to rent to his local customers. This will improve his business and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy more gas containers to rent to local customers.

loans.name: Zikula

texts.en:
Zikula is a single mother of three children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family (her sister and mother). 

She has a business of stone quarrying and has been in this business for seven years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shilling from MCDT SACCO to buy more hammers, axes and other machines, which will be used in stone quarrying. 

She works six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring of investing in a used clothes business and also educating her children up to university.    

She resides in her own house, and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more hammers, axes and other machines.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 20-year-old single lady from Nablus city. She lives with her family in a small house. Her father works as an employee in a local company in the city. Amal opened a beauty salon in the city. She loves this field and would like to have a big and modern salon in the future. 

Amal took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to open a new beauty salon and buy all the necessary tools, like chairs and beauty products, and do some decorations. Amal will help her father with part of the family expenses. 

Amal appears in the photo in her beauty salon.

loans.use: to open a new beauty salon and buy all the necessary tools, like chairs and beauty products, and do some decorations.

loans.name: Inoyat

texts.ru: Иноят жительница села района Шахристон, расположенный в северной части Таджикистана. Ей 41 год. Она замужем, имеет одного сына и дочь. Ее муж занимается сельскими делами. Сама Иноят уже 8 лет как разводит крупнорогатый и мелкорогатый скот. Ей помогает муж и дети. Иноят запрашивает кредит для закупа 4-х бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Иноят обычно откармливает скот в течение двух месяцев и затем продает с наценкой на скотном рынке.
texts.en: Inoyat is a resident of a village in the Shahriston district, located in the northern part of Tajikistan.  She is 41 years old, married and has one sons and a daughter.  Her husband is involved in agricultural business.  Inoyat has been breeding cattle and small livestock for 8 years.  Her husband and children help her.  Inoyat is requesting this loan to buy 4 bulls for increasing livestock headcount.  Inoyat typically fattens up livestock for two months and then resells it with a markup at a livestock market.

loans.use: to buy 4 bulls for increasing livestock headcount

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Isata.  She is married and has two children, aged 19 and 11 years. In 2011, Isata established her provisions and drinks store. She began her business, because she wanted to assist her husband in the upbringing of her children. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business.

Isata would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. She requires a loan, in order to buy some more goods to sell, including provisions, soft drinks, and cooking oil. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 600,000. In the future, Isata plans to open a mini supermarket. A hard-working woman, she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy some more goods to sell, including provisions, soft drinks, and cooking oil

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Mary. She is married and has two children, aged 7 years and 1 year. In 2011, Mary established her foodstuff business. She began her business as a way to complement the effort of her husband in terms of domestic problems. Working six days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 800,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. She requires a loan in order to buy bags of rice, bags of onion and some rubbers of cooking oil. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 500,000 SLL. In the future, Mary plans to rent a table in a central market to continue her business. She is hardworking and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, bags of onion and some rubbers of cooking oil.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is married with three children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. 

She has a business of selling fish and has been in this business for one year. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more baskets of fish. She generates additional income from farming. She works at the market and sells on a wholesale basis only six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

She is aspiring of starting to go to landing sites for fish, and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more baskets of fish.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente vive en casa de unos familiares junto a sus dos hermanos y su compañera de vida que actualmente espera un bebe. El trabaja en un taller de estructuras metálicas, también es mecánico automotriz, e instalador de cielos falsos, desde hace varios años, es una persona muy honesta, trabajadora y emprendedora que se esfuerza por salir adelante, los servicios que presta poseen mucha demanda,  de esta manera ha logrado solventar algunos de sus gastos familiares, el cliente solicita un crédito para la compra de materiales propios a la actividad del taller como herramientas, laminas, hierro, etc. para continuar con su negocio y  mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
The borrower pictured above lives with his two brothers and his wife who is expecting a baby. He works in a metal workshop as an auto mechanic and has several years experience in this area. He is a very hardworking, honest and entrepreneurial man who works hard to provide for his family.

The high demand for the mechanical services he specializes in means that this borrower has been able to work hard and cover the majority of his household expenses. With the support from this loan, he plans to purchase tools, sheet metal, iron and other materials for use in his workshop. He hopes this investment will help him to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase tools, sheet metal, iron, etc. for use in his metal shop.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: After graduating from junior high school, Rose decided to set up her own shop selling provisions, but currently she sells second-hand clothing in Ankyinyin (near Takoradi). With over six years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her by purchasing more second-hand clothing for resale. She aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a driver) with the upkeep of their house, whilst ensuring that their three children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more second-hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Flor De Monja Group

texts.es:
El señor Bonifacio, de estado civil casado, cuenta con 33 años de edad, no curso ni un año de educacion, tiene 5 hijos y los 5 estan estudiando, se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de cardamomo, inició este negocio ayudando a sus padres en el trabajo de agricultura y hasta la fecha lleva 17 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la limpieza de cardamomo, espera en el futuro sembrar mas cardamomo para obtener más ganancias,los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la siembra de cardamomo. En la fotografia figuran 19 miembros pero solamente a 15 de ellos se les otorgó el préstamo.
texts.en:
Bonifacio is 33 years old and is married. He was never able to receive an education, but he supports all five of his children in their studies. He makes a living as a cardamom farmer, a trade he learned while helping his parents on their farm. He now has 17 years of experience in agriculture. 

As a member of the group pictured above, Bonifacio plans to use the support from this loan to clean his cardamom crops and hopefully strengthen his farming operation. He hopes to plant more crops in order to expand his farm and generate more income. The other group members also make a living farming cardamom. Though there are 19 group members pictured above, only 15 of them are directly connected to this particular loan.

loans.use: to clean and tend his cardamom crops.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es: Doña Ofelia vive sola en casa propia, tiene 4 hijos que viven en hogares diferentes pero que le ayudan económicamente,   ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, mochilas y otros productos, desde hace 17 años es una persona honesta, responsable y muy trabajadora. Posee gran demanda  de sus productos, de esta manera ha logrado solventar algunos de sus gastos, Doña Ofelia solicita un crédito para la compra de mercadería como mochilas, carteras, cosméticos etc. por mayor  y  así mejorar su negocio  y aumentar su nivel de ventas, y de esta manera mejorar  su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Ofelia lives alone in her own house. She has four grown children who all live in different places but are still involved in her life and help her with household expenses. For the past 17 years, Ofelia has operated a store where she sells cosmetics, backpacks and many other products. She is a very responsible, honest and hardworking person.

Since the products she sells are in such high demand, Ofelia has been able to cover most of her living costs. With the support from this loan, Ofelia plans to purchase merchandise to stock her store, such as backpacks, purses, cosmetics, etc. She hopes that this investment will help her to increase her sales, strengthen her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase backpacks, purses, cosmetics and other items in bulk to stock her store.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 31 years old. She is married with three children; only two go to school. With the loan, she would like to buy more salt, cooking oil and flour for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings and pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more retail items such as soap, cooking oil and salt for sale.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is Hawa, from Liberia. She is 32 years old and lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known market towns in Montserrado county. Hawa was not fortunate enough to attend school, but she manages her business well to make ends meet. She sells for five days in a week, spending eight hours per day.  She and her fiancee are living together, along with two children ages 4 and 7. She said that only the older one is currently attending school, and they all live at home.
 
For the past six years she has been involved with her food sales business.  She explains that sometimes buying goes slowly, but most of the times she realizes profit.

Hawa is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more oil, pepper, rice, and other goods to sell. She plans, in the near future, to build a decent house. She appreciates the support of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, pepper, rice, and other goods to sell

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Doña Santos de 61 años de edad, es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su nieto,  ella es una persona responsable, honesta y muy amable con sus clientes  se dedica la venta de  pescado seco y otros productos relacionados  desde hace varios años  en el mercado que está cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que gana de sus ventas ha logrado solventar algunos de sus gastos. Doña santos solicita un crédito para la compra de más pescado, camarones etc. todo por mayor  para poder obtener mayores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Santos is 61 years old, and is a single mother who lives with her two children and one grandson. She is a very honest, responsible and kind woman who makes a living selling fish in the local market near her home. She has many years of experience in this area, and she leverages the income from her business to cover household expenses.

With the support from this loan, Santos plans to purchase shrimp and other fish in bulk for resale at her market stall. She hopes this investment will strengthen her business and allow her to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase shrimp and other fish in bulk for resale at her business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is a 45-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has six children. The oldest is 21 while the youngest is 13. She engages in fishing. She sells fish. She has been fishing for more than 10 years. She requested a loan of 9000 PHP to buy materials like plywood, epoxy (adhesive) and paint for boat renovation. In the future, Rosalinda would like to expand her fishing business to be able to provide her family with the best and hopes that she could purchase a new engine for the motorboat out of the profits she is earning.

loans.use: to buy materials like plywood, epoxy (adhesive) and paint for boat renovation

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Sarah, from Liberia. She owns and runs a table business at a market, where she sells Vita, oil, onion, and other goods. She has been doing this work for the past three years.

She lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known market towns in Montserrado County. She finished some college. She manages her business well. Sarah is unmarried, and she has six children between 8 and 21 years of age. Only four of them are currently attending school and live at home. 

She has asked for a 25,000 LRD loan. She will use the loan to buy more Vita, oil, onion, and other goods to resell. Sarah complains of the transportation cost as her main business challenge.  She enjoys the flow of her customers, and the profit she makes. She sells for ten hours each day. She hopes to build a house in the near future. She appreciates the supporters of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy more Vita, oil, onion, and other goods to resell.

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
Gulnaz is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of three. She has been doing tailoring for the past three years to help her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of their household together with the educational needs of their children. That is why she started her business to support her family well. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Now Gulnaz has requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 to purchase more reels of thread along with packs of buttons and laces in different colors. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Gulnaz hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread along with packs of buttons and laces in different colors.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr:
Akou est veuve et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est âgée de 42 ans et vit dans une chambre qu’elle loue dans le quartier Adidogomé, à Lomé. Couturière de profession, elle achète des pagnes puis les transforme en robes et habits pour femmes. Elle les revend dans les marchés de Lomé et de ses environs. 
Dynamique et accueillante, Akou voit son activité décoller ! Pour pouvoir répondre à la demande croissance, elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter 6 lots de pagnes et 12 bobines fils à coudre. Ses revenus lui permettront de mieux s’occuper de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Akou is a widow with five children. She is 42 years old and lives in a rented room in the Adidogomé neighborhood in Lomé. A seamstress by trade, she buys traditional “pagnes” fabric to make dresses and outfits for women, which she then sells at the markets at Lomé and in the region.
Energetic and friendly, Akou is seeing her business pick up! In order to meet the growing demand, she is  applying for a loan in order to buy six sets of pagnes and 12 reels of thread. Her revenues will allow her to better provide for her children’s needs.

loans.use: to buy seven sets of traditional fabric.

loans.name: Elmer Enrique

texts.es: Don Elmer de 40 años de edad, vive en casa de un familiar junto a su madre y su compañera de vida, él se dedica a la venta de mosquiteros lo hace de forma ambulante desde hace varios años, gracias a la calidad de sus productos ha logrado obtener gran demanda, además es un persona muy amable, honesta y responsable gracias a ello se ha ganado la confianza de sus clientes, de esta manera ha logrado solventar muchas de sus necesidades y las de su familia. Don Elmer solicita un crédito para la compra de mosquiteros por mayor porque le han solicitado en el mercado donde él los comercializa, y de esta manera obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elmer is 40 years old and lives lives with his wife and his mother. He makes a living traveling around selling mosquito nets, and he has several years experience in this area. Elmer is a very kind, honest and responsible person whose clients trust him, and thanks to the high quality products he sells, Elmer has been able to build his customer base and do well in his business to help provide for his family. 

With the support from this loan, Elmer plans to purchase mosquito nets in bulk to stock his business. He hopes this investment will help him to strengthen his business and generate increased income to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase mosquito nets in bulk to stock his business.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is 35 years old and a married woman. She has been running a business of cloth sales for the past three years. She is a mother of four children. It was very tough for Asia to manage her household expenses with the small income of her husband. Therefore she decided to help her husband in earning. For this purpose she started her business of cloth trade as she purchases fabrics of different varieties from the wholesale market and then sells them in her area. Now she is playing a very important role for her family.  

To purchase more variety of fabrics in different colors and designs, taking into consideration the demand of her customers, she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 through Kashf Foundation.  Asia expects a boost in her net income through her increased sales.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of fabrics in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana  currently operates a provisions shop, but she used to sell rice and beans in Ankyenyin  (near Cape Coast). Christiana is a divorcee with five children. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Christiana uses her income to provide for the entire family. Christiana will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of provisions, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. As she pursued her education only up to middle school, Christiana understands the importance of education in improving social conditions, thus she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that all her children remain in school.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of provisions

loans.name: Zeenat

texts.en:
Zeenat is a 47-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demand of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of ribbons, elastic and buttons. That will help her to stitch up more dresses on time. 

Zeenat is in her second loan cycle with a good loan history. She expects a boost in her earning and wishes to spend part of profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of ribbons, elastic and buttons.

loans.name: Rosetta

texts.en:
Rosetta is 41 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She completed 10th grade and she is married with six children between the ages of 16 and 29, only two living at home and attending school. Her husband is a security guard. 

Rosetta has been selling used clothes for the past four years and she is a very successful businesswoman. One thing she enjoys about her business is that it helps her generate more profit to send her children to school.

She’s requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She plans to send her children to the university in the near future. She thanks BRAC for their help.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business,

loans.name: La Confiance (3) Group

texts.en:
Jeanine is one of the members of the group, La Confiance (3). She is the leader of the group, comprised of eight micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. Jeanine is married and has four children, one of whom is currently in school. She also cares for two other children that are members of her household.

This is Jeanine's second loan cycle with HOPE Congo. She is going to use her share of this loan to purchase additional stock of used clothing for her store. She also makes fresh doughnuts and cold drinks for her customers who come to purchase clothes. Jeanine has noticed that prices in the market have been increasing, but she is working to differentiate her clothing store by providing a higher level of customer service.

In the future, Jeanine hopes that her increasing business activities will allow her to provide a high level of education to all of her children. She dreams of one day traveling abroad, to work directly with one of her suppliers.

loans.use: to increase her stock of used clothing for her store.

loans.name: Lideres De Villa Rica Group

texts.es: María es socia del grupo “Líderes De Villa Rica” conformada por 12 socios responsables que  llevan trabajando más de 01 año juntos. Con los deseos de contar con un negocio propio y de esta manera cubrir con los gastos del hogar María toma la decisión de emprender su negocio de venta de frituras como alita broster, salchipapas y hamburguesas, la cual lo realiza cada tarde en las afueras de su hogar. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de insumos como aceite, pollos, pan, papa y cubiertos. Seguir trabajando positivamente es su mayor deseo. María de 46 años es separada y tiene 05 hijos independientes. El grupo “Líderes De Villa Rica” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. María se encuentra en la parte posterior es la segunda del lado derecho y viste cafarena anaranjada y casaca marón.
texts.en:
María is a member of the group “Líderes de Villa Rica” (Leaders of Villa Rica), which consists of 12 responsible members who have been working together for more than a year.  They desire to have their own businesses so that they can cover their household expenses.

María decided to open a snack business in which she sells chicken wings, “salchipapas” (sausages and potatoes), and hamburgers.  She operates her business every afternoon outside of her home.  María is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies such as oil, chicken, bread, potatoes, and cutlery.  Her greatest wish is to continue working in a positive manner.  María is 46 years old, separated from her spouse, and has five independent children.  

The group “Líderes de Villa Rica” appreciates everyone who made this loan possible.  In the photo, María is standing on the back row, second from the right wearing an orange turtleneck and a brown jacket.

loans.use: to buy oil, chicken, bread, potatoes, and cutlery.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 47 years old and a married woman. She is the mother of seven children. She is a hardworking mother, who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000. She will use this amount to buy a stock of thread in various colors, along with packs of zippers, buttons and lace, to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread in various colors, along with packs of zippers, buttons and lace

loans.name: Dry Flower Shg Group

texts.en:
"The plight of my husband dead and not being able to live with my daughter makes me sad and haunts me," shares Hevei. Her husband passed away when her child was only one and a half years old. Her daughter stays with her husband’s family and Hevei returned to her parents' house. She is the featured borrower member for Dry-Flower group and she is pictured on the extreme left with her hand raised. Most of the members in their group are divorcees, single or widows. They joined the group to support one another financially and technically. All members live closed to one another in the same region which is about 40 kms far from the main capital town of Imphal, which is one of the capital states in North-Eastern India.

Hevei is a talented weaver and her finished products are highly in demand. She usually receives orders from neighbours and neighbouring villagers. Most of the time she fails to deliver them as she weaves with the traditional backstrap loom. Weaving with the help of the traditional back strap loom is time-consuming and tiring. Hevei generally receives a depository amount from those who placed an order and purchases the yarn and thread from the main market in the city. Once the piece is finished, she gets the full amount.  Her sister also helps her in weaving and both of them generate income for the family. 

The inability to put aside saving has immensely paralyzed her and made it difficult to efficiently work on her weaving activity. There are times when Hevei does not have enough money to purchase the yarn as most of her income is expended on her nieces and nephews educational fees. Her late brother had left his kids in her responsibility and she tries hard in all possible ways to manage. The demand is high during the wedding season; the bride generally takes several traditional wrap-around skirts along with her. The wedding season starts in the month of October and lasts till late April. 

Hevei wants a loan from Kiva to purchase different types of yarn and thread and keep them in stock so as to start weaving before the wedding season begins. She aspires to become the most successful weaver and highest supplier in the town. She says she will work hard and ceaselessly continue striving to get a loom and construct a separate chamber for weaving purposes. The joy is heard when she shares her plans and how she will work in future. She thanked Kiva and WSDS for everything and says “God Bless Kiva!”

The rest of the group members are also engaged in weaving, or piggery and vegetable selling businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more yarn and thread items for weaving different designs so as to earn more income.

loans.name: Nagina

texts.en:
Nagina is a 48-year-old, married woman. She is a vigorous lady and, for the past ten years, has been running a business of clothes sales. She buys clothes of different fabrics, in various colors and designs, from the market at wholesale rates. Then she sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

She is requesting a loan of Rs. 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. This will enable her to buy a wide variety of clothes in various colors and designs, to expand her inventory and attract more customers. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes to sell, in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 31 years old, married and a mother of two. She is very talented and excels making envelopes with the support of her husband. Parveen makes a large quantity of envelopes at home and sells them in the local market. 

Parveen is requesting a 25,000 PKR loan to buy bundles of good-quality paper and packs of glue to increase her sales and help her continue her business operations. She expects an increase in her business income as she expands. Parveen wishes to use the profits from her loan to provide a good quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy bundles of good-quality paper and packs of glue

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband assists her by purchasing goods from the wholesale market as he has maintained many contacts for years. She is the mother of six children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy packs of biscuits, tea and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of biscuits, tea and beverages.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor tiene 54 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa. Con mucho esfuerzo cada día trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de esteras y también como chofer de mototaxi, el cual inicio luego de mucho sacrificio y ahorro, Victor trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día  y puede atender hasta 20 clientes diariamente; Victor cree que está saliendo adelante con su negocio porque es muy responsable y siempre atiende a sus clientes con mucha amabilidad y sobre todo con  mucho respeto.

Victor esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar la reparación y mantenimiento de su mototaxi , con lo cual podrá tener un vehículo en buenas condiciones para poder realizar su trabajo, de esta manera podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una empresa de  transporte”.
texts.en:
Victor is 54 years old and lives in the town of Pucallpa. Every day he puts in a lot of effort working in his small business selling reed mats. He also drives a motorbike taxi, a second job he started after much sacrifice and saving of money. Victor works about ten hours daily and can have up to twenty customers in that time. He believes his business is doing well because he is responsible and serves his customers in a friendly and always respectful manner.

Victor is grateful to Kiva donors as it is thanks to their help that he will be able to repair and service his motorbike taxi. He will have a well-maintained vehicle for his work and earn more income. He will be able to continue working towards his great dream of owning a transportation business.

loans.use: Service and repair his vehicle

loans.name: Pahaj Central Group

texts.es:
Domingo es el representante del Grupo Pahaj Central (de camisa tipo polo de color corinto, el primero que se encuentra del lado derecho de la fotografía) es un hombre casado de 54 años de edad, vive junto a su  hijo en la Aldea Pahaj, Santa Lucía Utatlán, Sololá.
El  es un hombre trabajador que se ha dedicado al cultivo de maíz  desde hace 30 años. El ha elegido esta actividad porque puede alimentar a su familia durante un año y lo puede comercializar en el mercado local de su comunidad.
Comenta que desde pequeño sus padres le enseñaron esta labor,  ya que a través de lo que realiza obtiene ingresos y ganancias aceptables que le ayudan a cubrir los gastos de su familia. 
Los demás integrantes del grupo utilizaran la otra parte del crédito para la siembra  de maíz, con el fin de incrementar sus ganancias para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de abono orgánico para el cultivo de maíz.
Su sueño es ampliar su cultivo para obtener más ingresos y así brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Domingo is the representative of the Grupo Pahaj Central (seen on the right wearing a maroon polo shirt). He is 54, married, and lives with his son in the village of Pahaj, Santa Lucia Utatlán, Solola.

He is a hard worker who has been growing corn for 30 years. He has chosen this activity because it can feed his family for a year and he can sell the crop in the local community market.

He says that his parents taught him this work as a child, and through it, he has earned a passable income which helps cover household expenses.

Domingo's dream is to expand his crop to earn more income and thus provide a better quality of life for his family.

The other members of the group will use the rest of the loan to buy organic fertilize for growing corn, in order to increase profits and provide a better quality of life for their families.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for growing corn.

loans.name: Benson Njuguna

texts.en:
Benson, who comes from Muranga County in Central Kenya, is a father of five: three girls and two boys. To feed his family, he practices dairy and tea farming on his one-acre piece of land. Benson has four cows from which he gets income after the sale of milk. He also uses the cow manure to grow his food crops but buys fertilizer for his tea farm.

Because his home area is very hilly, his wife and girls suffer a great deal walking up and down the hills to the nearest forest to collect wood. This takes the whole of their Saturday when they should be resting or having their family time since they have to collect enough firewood for the whole week. The big load that they have to carry makes them suffer from backaches and pains at their hip joints.

To empower this family, VEP advanced Benson a loan to construct a biodigester that will be sufficient for the family's fuel needs. With a biodigester the family will have enough energy for cooking and lighting, and this will transform their lives. The women will not suffer from drudgery and smoke-filled kitchens, and they will also have time to rest and share some family time.

Benson will also no longer need to buy fertilizer, as the bio-slurry will be enough for both his crop and tea farming.

loans.use: To construct a biodigester

loans.name: Virginia Wanjiru

texts.en:
Virginia is a single mother of two -- a boy and a girl -- living in Thika in Kiambu county. On her half-acre piece of land inherited from her family, she keeps three dairy cows from which she gets income after milk sales. She also has a small grocery shop to add to her income. Being a single mother she has to take responsibility of all the family needs like providing for school fees and food.

As a member of one of VEP's groups, she learned that she could save a lot of money used on buying charcoal and kerosene by using biogas for cooking and lighting. She has borrowed a loan to facilitate the construction of a biodigester, and the money saved will be used to grow her grocery shop as well as repay the loan.

She has also seen an opportunity where she will use some of the bio-slurry to grow fodder, and the remaining slurry she will pack in containers and sell to increase her income. With biogas, Virginia’s life will not be the same again.

loans.use: to construct a biodigester

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: Rubén, de 42 años, está casado con Matilde y tiene 4 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Rubén se dedica a la agricultura con la venta de plátanos, yucas, cacao y otros productos, durante mucho tiempo sufrió algunos contratiempos en su vida, esto debido a que no tenía un ingreso propio para su hogar, es por eso que decidió empezar con la siembra de distintos productos regionales. Le gusta lo que hace, pues le permite tener tiempo para poder estar al cuidado de su vivienda, además que desde que empezó con su negocio le está yendo bien en su economía, ya que tiene ingresos para su hogar y desea seguir creciendo, por eso tiene en mente ampliar sus ventas. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
42-year old Rubén is married to Matilde and has four children. They live in their own house. Rubén is a farmer and grows bananas, yucca, cocoa and other crops. For many years he had many problems in his life as he did not have a regular source of income. For this reason he decided to grow different regional products.

He enjoys his work because it allows him time to maintain his home too. Also since he started his business, all has gone well financially. Now he wishes to grow the business and increase sales.

This is Rubén's first loan with Kiva and he is grateful for this financial assistance. He promises to pay back the money punctually. With the S/. 1500 he is seeking he will buy manure for his crops.

loans.use: Buy manure for his croos

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana, age 46, is a married woman and a mother of three children. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. By this time she has attained a regular list of customers. Due to low cash in hand she is unable to meet with the daily demand of her customers. 

For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is 52 years old and married and he has eight children aged between 20 and 6 years old.  He buys and sells cereals in bulk in Koisamo and has been in the business for a period of two years earning an income of KES 16,000.

He has borrowed a loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD, this being his first loan, and intends to use this amount to purchase bags of dry maize and beans for resale in bulk.  The profits he gets will be used to increase his business stock and also repay the loan.

His dream is to ensure that his family lives well.

loans.use: To purchase dry maize and beans for resale

loans.name: Felister

texts.en:
Felister is 27years old, single, and has 2 children. For the past nine years, she has run a boutique business in Oloitoktok town. Felister is also a farmer and she grows tomatoes and onions to sell. 

Felister is requesting her third loan with KADET LTD to purchase more stock of clothes and sewing materials to sell in her boutique. She also plans to buy fertilizer, seeds, and other farm inputs to improve her yield to increase her produce to sell. In the future, Felister hopes to buy a piece of land for farming and also provide better education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and sewing materials to sell

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She has been running an animal sales business for many years. Tasleem buys animals such as baby goats and calves at low prices and brings them up. Her husband then sells them in the market at higher prices. 

Tasleem is requesting a 25,000 PKR loan to purchase two more calves to improve her business. She is in her second loan cycle and she has a good repayment history. Tasleem hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better living standard for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase two calves

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 33 years old and is married. For the past seven years, he has distributed bread to various shops at Nairobi town at both wholesale and retail prices. Joseph’s business has been profitable. 

Joseph is requesting a loan to purchase more crates for packing the bread that he distributes to his customers. This is his second loan with KADET LTD and he has successfully repaid his previous loan. Joseph will use the expected profits from his loan to provide for his daily needs and ensure that his family has a good life.  In the future, he hopes to be a successful businessman and be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more crates to pack bread to distribute and sell

loans.name: Lucy Wangari

texts.en:
Lucy comes from Muranga in Central Kenya. She is married with two children, all in lower primary school. She shares a home with her mother-in-law, who has given her a portion of land to till and two dairy cows for her source of income. Every day she sells approximately eight liters of milk, and this money goes to supporting the family’s needs. Together with her husband, she also works as a casual laborer at a tea estate where she picks tea.

With their low income they cannot afford to buy LPG gas for cooking or install electricity in their home. so they rely on firewood for cooking and kerosene for lighting. This adds to her work of collecting pieces of wood along the way home from the tea farm. 
 
Being a group member of VEP, she learned that her family can save money spent on buying kerosene and time spent on collecting wood by having a biodigester constructed for them. With her two cows and four from her mother in-law, she will have sufficient fuel for cooking and lighting for both her family and her mother-in-law.

She has taken a loan to facilitate the construction, and money saved from the purchase of kerosene and her income from milk sales will be used to repay the loan.

loans.use: To construct a biodigester

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es: Doña Maria de 50 años de edad, vive en casa alquilada, junto a su hija quien posee una venta de pupusas, doña Maria se dedica a la venta de refrescos y licuados, su negocio lo tiene ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada y muy buena para las ventas, además de su excelente atención, es una persona responsable, trabajadora, honesta y respetuosa con sus clientes, de esta manera y con la ayuda de su hija ha logrado solventar algunos de sus gastos familiares, doña Maria solicita un crédito para surtir mas su negocio comprar más refrescos, agua etc. También para reparar cámara refrigerante y así aumentar sus ingresos, y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Maria, 50 years old, lives in a rented house with her daughter who has a business selling ‘pupusas’ (stuffed tortillas). Maria makes a living selling soft drinks and shakes. Her business is located near her place of residence in a very busy area, which is very good for sales. In addition to her excellent care, she is a responsible, hardworking, and honest person who is respectful with her customers. In this way and with the help of her daughter, she has managed to cover some of her household expenses. Maria is requesting a loan to stock her business with soft drinks, water, etc., and also to repair her display cooler, and that way increase her income and improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, water, etc., and to repair her display cooler.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 33 years old. He makes furniture and sells clothes, in Nairobi town. He is single. He has been in business for six years, now. 

This is his second loan with KADET, after having repaid his previous loan successfully. He intends to purchase wood for making more furniture, to sell in his business. This will also enable him to satisfy the needs of his customers. He will use the generated profits to provide for his needs. He hopes to be a great and successful businessman.

loans.use: To buy wood for making furniture.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 34-year-old, married woman and a mother of three children. Sajida has been running a business of animal sales for many years. She buys animals (e.g., baby goats and calves) at low prices, and brings them up. Then her husband sells them in the market, at higher prices. She is also involved in selling milk, to generate an extra amount of revenue.

Currently, Sajida requested a loan of PKR 30,000. She will use the loan to purchase two more calves. She is in her second loan cycle, with a good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children, through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Marvis Group

texts.en:
This group was created in 2010. It is made up of people who live in the same neighborhood and who work in commerce ( materials, plantain chips, fruit, yam and silver products).

The person on the far left of the photo (the only man in the photo), is Marvis, the leader of the group. He is 54 and married with two children.

His activity is tailoring and the sale of shirts and trousers. He has much experience in this business as he has been doing it since he was young.

With the loan, he plans to buy GHS 1300 worth of materials to sew shirts and trousers to sell.

His aim is to pay the school fees for his children and increase his savings.

loans.use: To buy GHS 1300 worth of materials to sew shirt and trousers to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase shoes to stock her business.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is a 35-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of buying and selling animals for many years. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). Her business is good enough to lead a decent life. For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf foundation and applied for a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase two more goats.  She is on her fourth loan and has a good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Rabeccah

texts.en:
Rabeccah does cash crop farming in Makueni town where she grows maize, beans, vegetables as well as fruits, such as pawpaws and mangoes for selling. She is 44 years old, married and blessed with six children. She has been in the farming business for five years and she currently makes a monthly income of 3,000 Kenya Shillings.

This is Rabeccah's first loan and she plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting in her farm. She will use the generated profits from the sale of her farm produce to pay school fees for her children.

In future Rabeccah, hopes practice large scale farming as well as provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Seema

texts.en: Seema is a 42-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband, who is also shown in the photo. Her husband also assists her by purchasing goods from the market and also by dealing with customers. Over time, they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and they make enough to meet the expenses of their six children. Currently, she is requesting a loan of  40,000 PKR to buy packs of grains, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at their store. She is on her fourth loan and has shown good repayment behavior. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of grains, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice  is a single mother of four children, three who go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  She has business of stone quarrying and has been in this business for nine years. She has applied for a loan of 300000 Uganda shilling from MCDTSACCO to buy more axes, pangas and other equipment to be used in stone quarrying. She generates additional income through hiring out her motorcycle. She works seven days a week.  Her major business challenge includes seasonality, thieves and law enforcement officers.  She is aspiring to hire men to assist in quarrying and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more axes, panga, hoes and other equipment.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary runs a cereals shop in Oloitoktok town. She sells maize, beans, rice and wheat. She is 34 years old, married and has been blessed with three children. She has been in the cereals business for three years, and her current monthly income is 8000 Kenya shillings. 

This is Mary's second loan term with KADET. She plans to buy more goods to sell, including beans, maize, and other cereals. She will use the generated income to purchase more stock, to expand her business even more. Her dreams for the future are to buy her own plot of land, and to provide better education for her children.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell, including beans, maize, and other cereals

loans.name: Maria Pilar

texts.es: María de 43 años de edad es una mujer muy trabajadora con esfuerzos y muy responsable. Actualmente vive con sus tres hijos, dos menores de edad que van a la escuela con esfuerzos de su madre y uno mayor de edad que le ayuda un poco en la economía del hogar, sus hijos son su fuente de inspiración para superarse día a día sin darse por vencida. Ella vive en casa propia desde hace 13 años poco a poco la ha ido trabajándola pues es lo único que le dejará a sus hijos, tiene un pequeño negocio donde vende ropa intima en una zona frecuentada de la ciudad y además vende zapatos de buena marca, es muy reconocida por los lugareños pues mantiene precios accesibles al público y además tiene un carisma a la hora de vender. María espera y desea remodelar su casa mejorando, levantando dos paredes para cerrar solar donde vive y mejorar el techo; es por eso que solicitó a FUSAI un préstamo el cual pagará con las ventas que realiza. Agradece las manos bondadosas que le ayudaron pues su sueño se hará realidad.
texts.en: Maria is 43 years old and is a hardworking and very responsible woman.  She lives with her three children, two of them still minors who attend school.  The other is an adult and helps her a little with the household finances.  Her children are her inspiration to succeed daily without giving up.  She has lived in a home of her own for 13 years and has been maintaining it little by little, because it’s the only thing she will leave her children.  She has a small business where she sells intimate apparel in a busy part of the city.  She also sells good brand name shoes and she is very well known by the locals because she has affordable prices and because she is friendly when making her sales.  Maria wants to remodel her home and add two walls and also repair the roof, so she is asking for a loan through FUSAI, which she will repay through her sales.  She is grateful to the helpful hands that helped her.  Her dream will become reality.

loans.use: to build walls and fix her roof.

loans.name: Pridon

texts.en:
Pridon is from the village of Vakiri in East Georgia. He is 49 years old and lives with his family: his wife and retired parents. Pridon does physical labor by special order. In summertime, he generally works for local farmers in return for a fee, but sometimes he works on house renovations to earn a living. He works hard all day long, but his income is still not stable and hardly enough to feed his family.

Pridon has requested a start-up loan for the purchase of onion and garlic seeds. He will sow the seeds and cultivate the plot of land. His goal is to be able to take care of his crops; otherwise he could lose his entire harvest as well as the time and money invested in it. Quality seeds are the prerequisite of a good harvest in spring. The produce he reaps will be sold locally and will generate good income. Pridon awaits your generosity.

loans.use: to purchase onion and garlic seeds for sowing

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is married with seven dependents  She has received some schooling till the end of middle school. Currently, Joyce sells cement in Ankyenyin (near Takoradi). She has been involved in this industry for about 10 years now. Her husband is an electrician. Joyce’s  income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. She will use the loan to increase her existing cement capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise,  she plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing cement capacity.

loans.name: Bethy

texts.en:
Bethy  is a small scale kenkey seller (kenkey is a traditional Ghanaian staple dish that is made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves) in Ankyenyin (near Cape Coast). She has had some form of formal education up to junior high school. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a driver. 

Bethy has been preparing and selling kenkey for close to eight years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of maize, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of creating a kenkey stand, which would allow her to sell from a fixed location.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of maize, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands.

loans.name: Maria Veronica

texts.es: María de 37 años de edad, vive felizmente junto a su esposo y sus hijos. Una mujer muy afortunada de tener la familia que tiene ya que es muy distinguida por unida y trabajadora. María es muy emprendedora siempre se ha caracterizado por dar lo mejor de si por ella y sus hijos con esfuerzos los mantiene estudiado y aunque se le haga difícil siempre vela porque nunca les falte nada. Ella se dedica al comercio de forma ambulante,  de ropa como blusas, pantalones, vestidos, camisas y calzado para hombre y mujer tiene forma de vender y es pos eso que siempre nunca se queda con mercadería pues mantiene precios estables y el carisma que la hace sobre salir de las demás. María desea mejorar su vivienda comprando lamina para ponerlo de techo y así mismo cerrar un cuarto que lo utiliza como bodega para guardar su mercadería es por eso que solicito a FUSAI un préstamo y cuenta con la satisfacción de pagarlos en el menor tiempo posible así ella se vera beneficiada mejorando lo que tanto desea para sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is 37 years old and lives happily with her husband and children. She is very grateful for her loving, tight-knit family. María is an entrepreneurial woman who works very hard to provide for her children and give them the best future possible. She makes a living traveling around selling men's and women's clothing, including blouses, pants, dresses, shirts, shoes, etc. With lots of charisma and perseverance, María is usually able to sell her entire stock of merchandise each month.

María's current project is to add another room onto her house so she can store her clothing merchandise in it. She plans to use the support from this loan to purchase building materials for the new room, and she promises to make all scheduled repayments on time. She hopes this investment will help improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and add a room onto her house for storing her merchandise.

loans.name: Trabajadores De Napoles Group

texts.es:
El señor Saulo Otomeo, de estado civil casado, cuenta con 27 años de edad, curso 3 años de educación secundaria, tiene 3 hijos que aun no estudian porque son pequeños, se dedica a la siembra de cardamomo, inició este negocio con un pequeño capital que le concedieron sus padres y hasta la fecha lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que le servirá para limpieza y mantenimiento de cardamomo, desea en el futuro contar con un capital mayor para poder sembrar mas cardamomo y de esa manera generar mas ingresos económicos. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la siembra de cardamomo. En la fotografia aparece una persona mas a quien no se le concedio el préstamo.
texts.en:
