Savoeurn will spend her loan portion to buy good ginger seedlings for replanting and potash as well as gasoline to pump water for her plantation. She hopes that she can grow her ginger seasonably and make a good yield with a high selling price so as she can keep her kids in school up to grade 12.

loans.use: To buy good ginger seedlings for replanting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and to pay the labor costs in the farm

loans.name: Sophany

texts.en:
One of the breadwinners in a family consisting of four children in school, Sophany is 47 years old and strives for a living via paddy rice farming on three hectares of land. It is the business that she has had for 30 years. This is the fifth loan for Sophany with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has managed her loan wisely to uplift her living conditions and keep her kids in school. 

Now, she is seeking an education loan to cover tuition fees for her daughter who is pursuing her bachelor's degree majoring in accounting. She hopes this loan will cover her daughter's education costs on time so her daughter can pay more attention to her studies and get a good degree.

loans.use: To cover tuition fees for her daughter

loans.name: Meki

texts.en:
Meki is 35 years old. She lives with her partner and they have four children. 

She runs a small business, selling ice cakes in her community and she has been doing this for two years. 

Meki has requested a loan to buy a deep freezer, sugar, cordial, chinese lollies, and foam cups. 

She joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Meki will provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy a deep freezer, sugar, cordial, chinese lollies, and foam cups.

loans.name: Odai

texts.en:
Odai is a 24-year-old, married man from Qalqilia. He lives with his wife and a his child in a simple house. 

For the past four years, Odai has been working in a stall where he sells bread and bagels. It is a profitable business, but Odai wants to expand it, so his income will be increased. 

Odai took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to build a small, roofed store near the city center, so he can sell bread and bagels in an easier condition, especially in the hot summer. 

Odai appears in the photo, while he was working in his store.

loans.use: to build a small, roofed store near the city center.

loans.name: Faasulu

texts.en:
Faasulu is 48 years old and married with nine children. She owns and operates a business venture, sewing. She has three years of experience in this line of business. 

Faasulu needs a loan to buy a sewing machine, a wooden design board, fabric designs, thread and materials. She hopes to use her profits to improve her business and help with her family matters. She joined SPBD in 2009.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, a wooden design board, fabric designs, thread and materials

loans.name: Vaniah

texts.en:
Vaniah is a 19-year-old woman who lives with her partner and has no children. 

She runs a small business selling pork buns in her community and has been doing this for two years.

Vaniah has requested a loan to buy flour, oil, a kerosene oven, yeast, a frying pan, chicken, onion, soy sauce and garlic. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Vaniah will extend her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, a kerosene oven, yeast, a frying pan, chicken, onion, soy sauce and garlic.

loans.name: Munkhchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Munkhchimeg, 47 years old, lives with her son and grandson in Darkhan, second largest city of Mongolia. The family resides in old house on a plot of land. She has been working as a train movement regulator at a train station for twenty-eight years. Her daughter lives in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia, and works as interior designer.

Mrs. Munkhchimeg is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, planks, fiberglass and foam in order to renovate her old house. By doing so, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where they will burn less coal thus releasing less pollutants into the air, a contribution to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has five children. She  has been in the farming business for more 15 years now, together with her husband. This is the source of their income.

Jocelyn is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and to pay labor costs for the farm. With this, Jocelyn will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her yield and income. In the future, Jocelyn has hopes of expanding her farming venture. In addition, Jocelyn wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and to pay labor costs for the farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fishing net.

loans.name: Ruba

texts.en:
Ruba is an 18-year-old single lady from a small village near Qalqilia city. Her father is a retired employee and he gets a low pension. Ruba and her family live in a simple old house in the city. 

Ruba is a student at a local university. She studies business administration in her second year. Because the economic conditions are not good, her father could not pay the university installments for her.
 
Ruba took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments this semester. By taking this loan, Ruba will be able to complete her study and find a job to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the university installments this semester.

loans.name: Lyra

texts.en:
Lyra is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. 

Lyra runs a sari-sari or variety store selling various goods and items to the people in her place. She is also engaged in farming.

Lyra is asking for a loan to pay for the school fees of her children and to buy fertilizer for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm and continually send her children to school.

loans.use: to pay the school fees of her children and to buy fertilizer for the farm.

loans.name: Zolzaya

texts.en: Mrs. Zolzaya, 34 years old, lives with her daughter in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. Currently her daughter is studying in Germany on a summer course. She also used to study and live in Germany. She has been running a video gaming center for one year and her business is running well due to few competitors in the market. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase a new version of Play Station in order to improve her business and get an edge in a competitive market. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who raised her daughter alone.

loans.use: to purchase a new version of Play Station for her business

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a a married woman and a mother of one child. She has been in the farming business for more than three years now, together with her husband. She works hard to support her husband in running their farm. This is the source of their income.

Lorna is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay the labor cost of the farm. With this, Lorna will be able to improve the productivity of the farm, thus augmenting her yield and income. 

In the future, Lorna hopes to make her business a success and a sustainable source of income. In addition, Lorna wants to save money for the educational expenses of her son.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay the labor cost of the farm.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris is a 23-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has three children.The oldest is 6 while the youngest is 3.  

She engages in fishing and she sells fish. 

She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy a flashlight, fishing net and nylon, to improve her catch. In the future, Maricris would like to expand her fishing business to support the education of her children and to uplift their livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy a flashlight, fishing net and nylon.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a a married woman who has been in the farming business for more 20 years now, together with her husband. This is the source of their income.

Marcela is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and to pay labor costs for the farm. With this, Marcela will be able to improve the productivity of their farm, thus augmenting her yield and income. In the future, Marcela has hopes of making her business a success and a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and to pay labor costs for the farm

loans.name: Elza

texts.en:
Elza is 37 years old, a young married woman. She lives with her spouse and three children (1, 11 and 14 years old) in the town of Kutaisi. The only source of income for the family is the small monthly salary earned by Elza’s husband, working at the local electric company. Elza is jobless at the moment.   She looks after her children and stays home, but she has a great desire to be involved in her own business.

 Elza couldn’t receive a loan from the local financial institutions, because of their requirements to have business experience or stable revenue, until the Start Up program began which is a joint product of Kiva and Credo. The program allows vulnerable poor like Elza to get a chance for starting or re-starting a a business. 

Elza requested a loan of 1000 USD to set up an indoor playground and party center for kids. Elza will rent the space, purchase playground equipment, hire children's entertainers and offer special party packages for children on their birthday. Elza hopes her business will be profitable, as there is not a similar center for kids nearby.

This will give her a chance to earn income and become financially independent. Thanks to the Start Up program, Elza will be able to make savings and provide a better future for her children.

loans.use: to start an indoor playground and party center for kids

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay the labor cost of the farm.

loans.name: Alofagia

texts.en:
Alofagia is a 24-year-old lady with no children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business.

Alofagia needs a loan to buy sugar, cordial, foam cups, Chinese lollies and a deep freezer. She plans to use her profits to help her family meet their daily needs and wants. Alofagia joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy  sugar, cordial, foam cups, chinese lollies and a deep freezer.

loans.name: Shoroq

texts.en:
Shoroq is a 20-year-old single lady from Tulkarem City. Her father is a worker with a very low wage. Shoroq and her family live in a simple old house in the city.

Shoroq is a student at a local collage. She studies an office secretary course and this is her last semester. Because the economic conditions are not good, her father could not pay the university installments for her.
 
Shoroq took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments this semester and also buy a new laptop. By taking this loan, Shoroq will be able to complete her study and find a job to help her family with part of the family expenses.

loans.use: to pay the university installments this semester and also buy a new laptop.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is 48 years old, married, and has 10 children. She would like to start a small business, selling elei lavalava (sarongs printed with traditional designs) in her community. In order to do this, Rosita needs a loan to buy stencils, fabric paints, brushes, carved wood designs and gloves. She hopes to use her profits to save for her family needs. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy stencils, fabric  paints, brushes, a carved wooden design and gloves, to produce elei lavalava (sarongs printed with traditional designs).

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred lives in the Kongowea area near Mombasa, Kenya. He is 39 years old, married and blessed with two children, aged  9 and 2 years. The elder child has started school. 

For the last one and a half years he has been running a retail shop. The business is doing great and he now thinks he can make it even better. When not at the shop selling, he is with his band doing music. 

He has an ambition of growing the business to wholesale in the next five years. He seeks a loan to buy retail products like sugar, rice and cooking fat. The challenges in the business are competition and funding. The extra income that is raised from the business will educate his children and give them better living standards.

loans.use: to buy retail products like sugar rice and cooking fat.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a hardworking married woman with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She operates a retail shop alongside farming in order to boost her income. The good mother that she is, she desires to educate her children up to the university and own a wholesale shop, despite challenges of limited funds and the high cost of rent.

Annah is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise such as soap, salt, sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as soap, salt, sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Imeda

texts.en:
Imeda is 35 years old. He is a graphic designer from the Akhaltsikhe district. He is married and lives with his wife, mother-in-law and four children (1, 8, 9 and 11 years old). Imeda is the only one who makes money in his household. He has rented a place in his district and is actively involved in the graphic arts industry. Imeda works on special orders and creates visual concepts of furniture, billboards, cars, architecture, etc., using computer software.  

He works hard and the business is going well, but his earnings are not enough for such a large family. For this reason, Imeda decided to diversify the business and requested credit from MFO Credo to purchase souvenirs and jewelry for selling. Imeda will purchase them in the capital city at wholesale prices from his friend and display the items in the commercial space where he works. He will hire a salesperson and hopes that the business generates additional income.

He is a very enthusiastic and energetic young man with a great desire to get ahead. Imeda awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase souvenirs and jewelry for selling.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is 28 years old and single. She has been operating a water point for the last three years, and her business has really grown. She knew Milango through friends and now seeks a loan to open another water point in town. The major challenge that she deals with is water shortages. The extra income raised from the business will improve her living standards.

loans.use: to open another water point.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJEKAFO, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 40 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Baou quartier Bamanan commune de Banco, préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales (mil mais et du riz) et du beurre de karité. Les femmes du groupe DJEKAFO sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. La cliente Alimata, la première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises compte acheter du dah avec son argent qu’elle  transforme en condiment (Sounbala) qui sera vendu à ses clientes. Elle compte réaliser 8.000FCFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permet de couvrir les frais de condiment dans son foyer.
texts.en:
The group called Djekafo, composed of married women who have an average age of 40 and on average two children, and all live in traditional extended families in the village of Baou, Bamanan neighborhood, Banco area, Dioila prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali.)

They met through ties of kinship, neighborhood and friendship. They sell cereals (millet, maize, and rice) and shea butter. The women of this Djekafo group are on their second solidarity loan. Alimata, the first person from the left, seated, intends to buy "dah" with her loan. She will make the "dah" into a condiment ("sounbala") to sell to her customers. She expects to make 8,000 F CFA each month. This profit will permit her to cover expenses for condiments in her household.

loans.use: to purchase "dah" to transform into a condiment.

loans.name: Fialelei

texts.en: Fialelei is a 51-year-old single woman with no children. She makes and sells barbeque in her community to earn a living. She has five years of experience with this business. Fialelei needs a loan to buy box of chicken and mutton flaps, sausages, soy sauce, foam plates, onions, tomato sauce and barbeque sauce. She plans to use her profits to buy a new barbeque oven. Fialelei became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy box of chicken and mutton flaps, sausages, soy sauce, foam plates, onions, tomato sauce and barbeque sauce to produce and sell barbeque.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en: Marietta is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has four young children. She has been in the farming business with her husband for more five years. This is the source of their income. Marietta is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay labor costs on the farm. With this loan, Marietta will be able to improve the productivity of the farm, thus augmenting her yield and her income. In the future, Marietta hopes to make her business a success and a sustainable source of income. In addition, Marietta wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay labor costs on the farm.

loans.name: Logo

texts.en: Logo is 38 years old, married, and has three children. She has a small garden where she grows plants in flower pots that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. Logo needs a loan to buy planting pots, fertilizer, a rake, a garden hose and gloves. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Logo will use the profits from her sales to provide for family’s daily needs.

loans.use: to buy flower pots, fertilizer, a rake, a garden hose and gloves to grow plants to sell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a widow and has five children. She has been in the farming business for several years. This is the source of her income. Marina is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay labor costs on the farm. With this loan, Marina will be able to improve the productivity of the farm, thus augmenting her yield and her income. In the future, Marina hopes to make her business a success and a sustainable source of income. In addition, Marina wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay labor costs on the farm.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has five children. She has been in the farming business for more 12 years now, together with her husband. This is the source of their income. Raquel works hard to support her husband in managing their farm.

Raquel is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay the labor costs for the farm. With this loan, Raquel will be able to improve the productivity of the farm, thus augmenting her yield and income. In the future, Raquel has hopes of making her business a success and a sustainable source of income. In addition, Raquel wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and pay the labor cost for the farm.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a 64-year-old woman from the town of Duero, Bohol. She is married with five adult children. Rosita has been engaged in farming spring onions for 22 years now, together with her husband. 

She is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy fertilizer, seeds and a sprayer for her business. She is confident that with her hard work and additional inputs for farming, she can expand and improve her business.

Rosita also hopes that with her business, someday, she can also save enough to live in comfort in her old age.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and a sprayer.

loans.name: Rodgers

texts.en: Rodgers lives in Mombasa Kenya. He is 26 years old and is married. He operates a grocery store in town that has been in operation for the last three years. He is employed and earns a salary, and he has hired someone to run the business on his behalf. The perishability of the commodities he sells is the challenge he has to deal with every day. In cases where customers do not buy everything from the store, he incurs losses, despite his good management of the business.  He looks forwards to brighter days. He learned about Milango through a friend, and now he is applying for a loan to buy a sack of cabbages, a sack of kale and bucket of tomatoes. The income he makes from the business will improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy a sack of cabbages, a sack of kale and bucket of tomatoes for his grocery store.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge cuenta con 53 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de maíz, yuca y frijol actividad que desempeña desde los 15 años de edad. Además, mantiene ganado lechero, el cual le genera entradas económicas.  Vive con su esposa y 3 hijos, los cuales estudian y trabajan, 2 son hombres y 1 es señorita; las tierras que trabaja se encuentran a 15 metros de distancia, el horario de trabajo es de 6 de la mañana hasta las 11:30 del día, luego resto del día se lo dedica a cuidado del ganado.  Antes de marcharse al trabajo ordeña a las 3 de la mañana sus vacas y saca la leche para vender. 

El crédito lo solicita para comprar fertilizantes, pesticidas, herbicidas, mano de obra para terminar la siembra de 7,000 metros cuadrados de yuca y otros 7,000 de maíz, las cuales esta cultivando en tierra alquilada.
  
Su deseo es, comprar más ganado y  mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda. Disfrutar de sus nietos y que sus hijos sean unos profesionales.
texts.en:
Jorge is fifty-three years old, and makes a living in agriculture, specifically in growing corn, yucca, and beans.  He has carried out this work since he was fifteen years old.  He also maintains dairy cattle; this generates economic profits for him.  He lives with his wife and their three children.  His kids study and work, and he has two sons and one daughter.  The lands that he works are located 15 meters away, and his work schedule is from 6AM-11:30AM.  He dedicates the rest of the day to his livestock.  Before leaving for work in the morning, he milks the cows at 3AM so that he can sell the milk.

The loan he requests will be used to buy fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides, and to pay for the labor to finish planting 7,000 square meters of yucca and another 7,000 square meters of corn, which he is cultivating on land that he rents.  

His dream is to buy more livestock, improve his living conditions, enjoy his grandchildren, and for his children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides, and to pay for the labor to finish planting 7,000 square meters of yucca and another 7,000 square meters of corn, which he is cultivating on land that he rents.

loans.name: Boldkhurel

texts.en: Mr. Boldkhurel, 37 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been providing taxi services to local people since 2008. Before starting this job, he used to work at a building company. He is applying for a loan of 3,200,000 MNT to purchase a truck, in order to transport heavy goods around the city for extra income. His wife is currently unemployed, so he is looking for any ways to generate income to provide for his family, and he decided to transport goods between districts. During the summertime, transportation service reaches its peak prosperity. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy a truck and start a business transporting heavy goods.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en: Marjorie is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has two children. She has been in the farming business with her husband for more three years. This is the source of their income. Marjorie is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay labor costs on the farm. With this loan, Marjorie will be able to improve the productivity of the farm, thus augmenting their earnings and profits. In the future, Marjorie hopes to make the business a success and a sustainable source of income. In addition, Marjorie wants to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay labor costs on the farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and supplements.

loans.name: Vengie

texts.en: Vengie is a fisherman from Bohol, Philippines. He has been in the fishing business for more than 4 years now. This is the source of his income. Vengie is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items. With this, he will be able to improve his catch thus allowing him to sell more fish in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay labor costs on the farm.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She has been in the farming business for more 15 years now together with her husband. Her husband also works as a carpenter.  This is the source of their income.
Vilma is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and to pay labor costs in the farm. With this, Vilma will be able to improve the productivity of the farm thus augmenting her yield and income. In the future, Vilma hopes to make her business a success and a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and to pay labor costs in the farm

loans.name: Zonia Magdalena

texts.es:
Zonia, vive con sus hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 20, 25 y 30 años, todos dependen del negocio, ya que ella se dedica a la elaboración, venta de tamales y pupusas, dicha actividad la realiza todos los días con la diferencia que los tamales solo por la tarde y en la cual sus hijos le ayudan.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar la materia prima, tales como: maíz, quesillo, chicharrón, repollo, condimentos, entre otros. Esta inversión le ayudara al fortalecimiento del negocio.
Su sueño es adquirir mejores ingresos y que sus hijos continúen estudiando en la universidad.
texts.en:
Zonia lives with her children, ages 20, 25, and 30.  They all depend on her business.  She makes a living in making and selling tamales and stuffed tortillas.  She carries out this activity every day, but only sells the tamales in the afternoon, when her children can help her.

The loan that she requests will allow her to buy basic ingredients, like: corn, fresh cheese, pork cracklings, cabbage, condiments, and other items.  This investment will help her to strengthen her business.

Her dream is to have a better income and for her children to continue studying at the university.

loans.use: to buy corn, fresh cheese, pork cracklings, cabbage, condiments, and other items.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen lives in Kongowea area near Mombasa Kenya. She is now 53 years old and she is in the clothes business. She is happy that she received a Kiva loan before which she paid back without much challenges and now she seeks another loan to add more clothes in to the business. She knew Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to purchase men's and ladies' clothes to resell. She also loves farming. The major challenge in the business that she has to deal with is competition with other traders and lack of funding. The income she raises from the business will improve her standards of living.

loans.use: To purchase men's and ladies' clothes to resell.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 19 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma, in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past three years, Caroline has been working hard to manage her boutique where she sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Caroline  has requested a loan of UGX 800,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes and will help Caroline to generate greater profits and increase her capital. 

Caroline hopes that, in the future, she will be able to expand the business. 

Caroline is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TIESSIRI, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 41 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Baou quartier Bamanan commune de Banco, préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales (mil mais et du riz) et du beurre de karité. Les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. 
La cliente Zélé, la première personne à droite dans le rang des débout compte acheter 5 sacs de riz paddy et 2 sacs de niébé. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 21600 FCFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permet de se vêtir et d’aider son mari dans la résolution des problèmes familiaux.
texts.en:
The group TIESSIRI consists of married women who average 41 years of age and five children each, and who all live in extended traditional families in the village of Baou, which is located in the district of Bamanan, commune of Banco, in the Dioila prefecture of the Koulikoro region (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They know one another as neighbors and friends, and through ties of kinship. They sell cereals (millet, maize and rice) and shea butter. The members of the group TIESSIRI are now seeking their 2nd group loan.

Zélé, standing first from the right in the photo, plans to buy five sacks of paddy rice and two sacks of cowpeas. She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 21,600FCFA, which will allow her to clothe herself and to support her husband in dealing with family issues.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products.

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es: Eugenio, de 58 años es un hombre trabajadora. Vive en compañía de sus 2 hijos en la casa de su hermana. Tiene 34 años de experiencia en la agricultura, todos los días sale a verificar sus tierras de cultivo y su esposa es su principal apoyo; los cultivos principales que produce son papa, trigo, cebada y quinua. También se dedica a la crianza de animales de ganado ovino.  Sus mayores ingresos se ven en la siembra de los granos por lo que cada vez más el intensifica su siembra en estos productos. Muchas veces para él y su familia este es un trabajo agotador pero que se compensa con las ganancias que le permiten cubrir sus gastos además de que siempre tiene disponible alimentos para su propio consumo y eso es una ventaja grande para su familia por lo que seguirá trabajando en esta actividad y mejorando la calidad de los suelos  cultivándola con abonos.Este es el segundo crédito con kiva, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues le enseñaron en su asociación a ser responsable y agradecido. Eugenio, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para distribuir entre sus próximos sembríos.
texts.en: Eugeniois 58 years old and a hardworking man.  He lives with his two children at his sister’s house and has been working as a farmer for 34 years.  He checks his farmland daily.  His wife is his main source of encouragement and mainly raises potatoes, wheat, barley, and quinoa.  He also raises poultry.  His main income comes from his raising of grains, which he continually increases.  Many times this work is very exhausting for him and his family, but it allows them to cover their expenses, and he has food available.  This is an advantage for his family and he will continue working in this field and improving the quality of the farmland with fertilizer.  This will be his second Kiva loan and he promises to be on time with his payments because his group taught him to be responsible and grateful.  Eugenio will invest money in compost to spread on his next crops.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth runs a vulcanizing shop in her place in Ubay, Bohol together with her husband. She is also engaged in a hat-making business.

Elizabeth is asking for a loan to buy materials for her repair shop like screwdrivers and other items. With this, they will be able to cater to more customers in their shop thus augmenting their income.

loans.use: to buy materials for her repair shop like screwdrivers and other items

loans.name: Noun

texts.en:
Noun, 55, is a married woman and she has seven children of various ages. Five, among her children, have already settled for marriage, while the other two are in her burden. 

Noun didn't complete her elementary school, due to economic problems of her family. She then got married to her husband and started a farming business, growing rice and soybeans over the past 33 years. The challenge of her business is having a healthy crop that's protected from pests and diseases because, in the market, the supplies to attack this type of crop danger are expensive and the prices are unstable.

Noun has requested a loan through the Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) branch office to hire people to transplant her rice. This way, she can maintain her crops in a suitable manner and at the right time. 

As a result of the loan, she hopes to have an abundant harvest to sell for a profit.

loans.use: to hire people to transplant her rice.

loans.name: Yassenia Maribel

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Noviembre.

En este lugar vive la señora Yessenia, tiene 19 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 5 y 2 años de edad, el mayor este año empezó a estudiar en un jardín de infantes. Su esposo es oficial de un bus. 

Doña Yessenia para ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar a su marido con los gastos que generan sus hijos y el hogar se dedica a la venta de alimentos, los fines de semana ella instala unas mesas en el centro del pueblo en la cual se dedica a vender tostadas, batidos de frutas, chifles con ensaladas entre otras cosas, tiene recién un año con su negocio el cual cada día esta mejor ya que son más las personas que llegan  a servirse lo que ella prepara.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas, pan y otros víveres que ella necesita para preparar los alimentos. Lleva un año en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias al  crédito empezó su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener un buen local.
texts.en: Montecristi is a city known for its diversity of cultural items, like for example, the sombrero toquillo (straw hat), which is well known in and out of the country. This is where Yessenia, 19, lives. She is married and has two children, who are 5 and 2. The oldest started kindergarten. Her husband is a bus driver. Yessenia wanted to get a job to help her husband with the household expenses, so she started selling food. On the weekends, she installs tables in the centre of town and she prepares and sells toast, fruit shakes and chifles (banana/plantain chips) with salads, among other provisions. She's been running her business for a year and it's getting better every day as more people go to her to buy what she prepares. With this loan, she'll buy fruit, bread and others ingredients that she needs to prepare food. She's been with the communal bank for 1 year and enjoys it as she's been receiving the help she needs to open and run her business. Her dream is to have a good locale.

loans.use: buy fruit, bread and other provisions.

loans.name: Claris

texts.en: Claris lives in the Mariakani area. She is married and has seven children. Six of them attend school. She has had a previous loan with Kiva, which she paid back, and she now seeks another loan to buy sugar, maize flour and cereals to sell. Her business is doing great despite the challenges of competition and bad debts which are inevitable in her business. The income she raises from the business will improve her living standards.

loans.use: To buy sugar, maize flour and cereals wholesale.

loans.name: Mapatano 2 Group

texts.en:
Zuhura, who is in her early 40s, is single with two children who are still going to school.  She has been selling fish for two years now.  She works from 8:00 am to 2:00 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Zuhura's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy a freezer for keeping fish fresh.  She also bought more fish from upcountry.  She has special customers who she calls to come and buy fish, and immediately she gets them.  She is really doing great. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses.  She wants a loan to buy more fish to resell.  She dreams of buying her own place for selling her fish and buying another freezer.

Zuhura will share this loan with her loan group "Mapatano 2", which has seven people who will hold eachother accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Trust Group

texts.en:
Joktan, who is in his early 40s, is married with four children who are in school. Joktan is running a carpentry business since 1987. He is designing different furniture and more wooden items by receiving orders from different customers. Joktan works from 08am to 06pm daily and is able to make a fair return per month. This is Joktan's 9th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania which he will use to buy more woods. With the previous loans all of which he paid back successfully, he bought more woods and other business equipment. He used also the loans to cover his business expenses like electricity. With the profit earned, he covered his children's school expenses, household expenses and bought a plot of land where he built a house.   Joktan dreams that one day he will able to give a better education to his children and have a better life. 
He will share this loan with his loan group "TRUST" which totals 9 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more wood.

loans.name: Mapatano 1 Group

texts.en:
Zaituni, who is in her early 30s, is married with two kids, a boy and a girl who are in school. Zaituni has been running a food business selling chips with fried chickens, eggs and roasted meat. She is in this business for a period of ten years now. Zaituni works from 08am to mid-night every working day and is able to make a very good return.
This is her third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania which she will use to buy a sack of Irish potatoes, eggs, chickens and more cosmetics. With the previous loans all of which were paid back successfully, she started selling cosmetics, bought more chip-making items like potatoes, eggs and chickens. Zaituni used her business profit to cover school fees, household expenses and bought a plot of land. She dreams that one day will be able to build her own house. 
She will share this loan with her loan group "Mapatano 1" which consist of 6 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a sack of Irish potatoes, eggs, chickens and more cosmetics.

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKOLA, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 36 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Sanakorodjeda commune de Banco, préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréale, de fruit et des légumes. Les femmes du groupe BENKOLA sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. Avec ce prêt,  la cliente Awa Doni,  la troisième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises ,  compte acheter 10 régimes de  banane avec son argent dans les plantations du village de Sanakorodjeda et Koula. Elle vend sa banane à Baoufoulala et ce lui de Banco. Son cycle achat vente est d’une semaine. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 24000FCFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permet de couvrir les dépenses familiales et de s’occuper convenablement de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The group BENKOLA consists of married women who average 36 years of age and four children each, and who all live in extended traditional families in the village of Sanakorodjeda, located in the commune of Banco, in the Dioila prefecture of the Koulikoro region (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another as neighbors and friends, and through ties of kinship. They sell cereals, fruits and vegetables. The members of the group BENKOLA are now seeking their 2nd group loan. 

Awa Doni, sitting third from the left in the photo, plans to use her loan to buy 10 bunches of bananas from plantations in Sanakorodjeda and Koula. She sells her stock in Baoufoulala and in Banco. Her process of buying and selling is typically a one-week cycle. She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 24,000FCFA, which will allow her to cover family expenses and to provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy fruits.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 37 años, está casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. El trabajo de Luz consiste en la compra y venta de repuestos vehiculares. Ha establecido su negocio en la parte frontal de su casa ya que su esposo es mecánico y repara motos y mototaxis. Abre sus puertas diariamente en espera de las personas que desean comprar alguna pieza o repuesto de reparación. Lleva realizando este trabajo desde hace 1 año gracias a un crédito que le brindaron anteriormente y lo hace a lado de su pareja. Se siente muy bien con su actividad ya que le permite tener buenos ingresos económicos, así mismo puede estar en su hogar y atender a sus hijos como ella desea. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1200, está muy emocionada al saber que hay personas que le brindan un respaldo económico para continuar desarrollando su actividad laboral, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará mas repuestos y piezas de reparación vehicular como ejes, faros, bujías, cadenas y llantas para continuar vendiendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Luz is 37 years old, she is married, and she lives together with her husband and her four children in their own home. Luz works buying and selling spare automotive parts. She established her business out of the front of her home, as her husband is a mechanic and repairs motorcycles and a mototaxis. She opens daily and attends to customers who wish to purchase spare and repair parts. She has been managing this business for one year, thanks to a loan she previously received along with her husband. She feels great about her work as it allows her have good financial income while also staying at her home and looking after her children as she likes.

With this loan she is requesting S/. 1200. She is very excited to know that there are people out there offering financial support so that she can continue to develop her business. Furthermore, she promises to pay her installments in a punctual manner. With the amount requested she will purchase additional spare automotive parts such as axles, lights, plugs, chains and tires in order to continue making sales in her business.

loans.use: purchase spare parts for vehicles.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 29-year-old woman from the town of Sierra Bullones, Bohol. She is married, with four children ages four months and three, seven and eight years old. 

Marites has been engaged in farming vegetables for eight years now. She produces pechay (bok choy), which is one of the staple vegetables in the country. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy fertilizer, seeds, and a sprayer. This will help her sustain her business while waiting for the harvest season.

Marites hopes that someday she can expand her business and improve the land that she cultivates for a better income. Any profit generated, will be for her children's education and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and a sprayer.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a hardworking man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He sells fresh foods and with the proceeds he has been able to pay school fees for his children. Like most traders in the same business he faces challenges of perishability and poor storage facilities. His dream is to have a modern food store. Richard intends to use the loan to buy tomatoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Farruh

texts.ru: Фарруху 18 лет. Он успешный студент и добрый по натуре человек. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Фаррух является студентом Худжандского Государственного Университета по специальности Финансы и кредит. Фаррух учится успешно и является активным студентом. Он читает много книг. Фаррух помогает родителям в свободное время от учебы по земледелию, так как земледелие является основным источником дохода ее семьи. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Farruh is eighteen years old.  He is a good student and a kind-natured person.  He is not married and lives with his parents.  Farruh is a student in the Khujand State University in the department of Finances and Loans.  Farruh is successful in his studies and is an active student who reads many books.  

In his spare time, Farruh helps his parents with farming, which is the main source of income to his family.  He needs to pay for his university tuition but he does not have the money to do so.  He is asking for a loan to pay for his education.  He is waiting for your kindness and is hoping for your generosity.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition at the university

loans.name: Betty Margarita

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Noviembre.

En este lugar vive la señora Betty, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 11 y 5 años que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es ebanista.

Doña Betty como buena esposa que es realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo invierta en su trabajo, él tiene un pequeño taller de ebanistería, allí trabaja todo el día dándole forma a la madera, elabora todo tipo de muebles como camas, cajoneras entre otros productos, él realiza sus obras bajo pedido y también en ocasiones entrega en Manta a una mueblería de esa ciudad, lleva más de 4 años con su taller y con eso el lucha para que nada les falte a su familia.

Este crédito es para comprar madera, pintura, clavos y otros materiales más para elaborar sus obras. Lleva tres años   en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ella puede ayudarle a su marido. 

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its diversity of traditional products such as Panama hats and shawls famous in and outside of the country, members of the November 4th Community Bank meet every two weeks. 

This is where Betty lives. She is 32 years old, married, and has two children ages 11 and 5 who are studying in school. Her husband is a carpenter.

Betty, being the good wife that she is, is submitting this loan request for her husband to invest in his business. He has a small carpentry workshop where he works each day giving form to wood. He makes all kinds of furniture, such as beds, dressers, and other items. He makes his furniture to order and sometimes also delivers products to a shop in the city of Manta. He has been in his workshop more than four years, and it is his way of fighting to ensure that his family wants for nothing. 

This loan will go to purchasing wood, paint, nails, and other supplies for completing his work. Betty has been a member of the Community Bank for three years, and she likes that she able to help her husband through these loans. 

Her dream is to provide the best for her little ones.

loans.use: purchase wood, paint, nails, and other supplies.

loans.name: Esfuerzo Vecinal Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 6 mujeres  responsables a distintas actividades comerciales. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “ESFUERZO VECINAL” una de ellas es la Sra. Sherley  de 30 años soltera y con 2 hijos,la Sra. sherley se dedica ya hace 3 años a la venta de ropa  tanto para damas como para caballeros en un pequeño local  todos los días con el merito de salir adelante y tener un ingreso mas, Con el fruto de su esfuerzo la Sra.  sherley  ha logrado mejorar su  vivienda y también la educación de sus hijos y Seguir mejorando en su negocio. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más ropa  y así poder tener más ingresos.la Sra. Sherley  se encuentra en medio del grupo se le distingue con polo amarillo, A la vez se despide con un abraso a Kiva y  agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en:
Esfuerzo Vecinal Group is made up of six responsible members engaged in a variety of commercial activities.

One of the women is Sherley, 30.  She's single and has two children.  Every day for three years Sherley has worked selling clothing for both women and men in a small shop so she can get ahead and have another income.  With the fruit of her effort she has managed to improve her home, her children's education, and her business.

She'll invest the loan in buying more clothing to have more income.

Sherley's in the middle of the group, wearing a yellow polo shirt.  She signs off with a hug for Kiva.  She's grateful for the loan granted because it makes it possible for her to progress.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Muheza Group

texts.en:
Joyce, who is in her late 30s, is married with a son who finished ordinary level school. Joyce is looking forward to taking her son to the advanced level. Since 2012, Joyce has been running a retail shop selling different items like soft drinks, dry foods, airtime, different types of soap, etc.  She is doing great in her project. Joyce works from 8:00 am to 10:00 pm daily with the ability to earn a fair profit per month. 

This is her first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to restock the missing items in her retail shop. Joyce dreams that one day she will be able to own a big business. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Muheza", which consists of four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the missing items in her retail shop.

loans.name: Aldo

texts.es:
Aldo tiene 33  años, vive en casa de su suegra en un asentamiento en la ciudad de Paraguarí, está acompañado con la Sra Mirian, tienen un  hijo de 2 años de edad, quien es el motivo de lucha de la pareja.
Aldo emprendió su actividad como costurero a los 13 años de edad con su padre, se independizo hace dos años, luego de trabajar 8 años con su padre, mediante mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio pudo adquirir su primera máquina de coser y de esa forma poder formar su propia clientela. Aldo es un señor muy sacrificado quien se esfuerza diariamente para brindarle lo mejor a su familia.
Necesita el crédito para la compra de otra máquina de coser ya que cuenta con muchas demandas de sus prendas.
texts.en:
Aldo, 33, lives in his mother-in-law’s house in a settlement in the city of Paraguarí.  His spouse is Mirian and they have a two-year-old son who motivates the couple to strive.

Aldo learned clothes making at the age of 13 from his father and started to work independently two years ago after working with his father for 8 years.  By means of much effort and sacrifice he was able to acquire his first sewing machine to be able to establish his own clientele.  Aldo is a very self-sacrificing man who strives daily to provide the best for his family.  He needs the loan to buy another sewing machine because his clothes are in high demand.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Muvafe Group

texts.es:
Muvafe es un grupo nuevo, esta en su ciclo numero uno, ellas estan esperanzadas que por medio de la ayuda de la fundación podrán ir mejorando sus vidas, gracias a las capacitaciones y las demás actividades que hacen. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia con gran entusiasmo.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Gabriela, quien es la presidenta del grupo, cuenta que serlo es una gran responsabilidad, pero que lo esta haciendo muy bien. Se dedica a su negocio de Ciber, donde trabaja día a día, y gracias a que tiene muy buena clientela esta saliendo adelante. Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su ciber y también para mantenimiento de sus computadoras. Agradece por esta ayuda que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Muvafe is a new communal bank in its first loan cycle.  The members hope that through the help from the foundation they will be able to improve their lives thanks to the training and other activities they will be involved in.  They are all heads of household who are very enthusiastic.

One of the members is Gabriela, who is the president of the group and believes her role carries a lot of responsibility, but she is doing it very well.  She runs an Internet cafe where she works every day.  Thanks to the very good clientele she has, things are prospering.  She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her Internet cafe and for computer maintenance.  She is grateful for this support which will be very helpful.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her Internet cafe and for computer maintenance.

loans.name: Lapacho Florido Group

texts.es:
El grupo lapacho florido esta haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, de donde se pudo tener que algunas de las integrantes se encuentran con ingresos muy bajos, pero ellas están trabajando por mejorarlo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra Teresa, quien tiene una pequeña, pero bien surtida despensa, la cual con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo está sacando adelante. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que lucha por salir adelante.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, gaseosas, comestibles, arroz y demás insumos para poder seguir con sus ventas y de esa forma seguir dando a sus clientes todo lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
The Lapacho Florido Group is part of the "Poverty Stoplight" program (read more about this below), in which some of its members may have very low income though are working to improve that situation.

One of the group's members is Teresa, who has a small but well-stocked bodega which, through a lot of sacrifice and hard work, she is striving to make successful. She is a very hardworking person who is fighting to get ahead.

Teresa is requesting this loan in order to purchase beverages, sodas, grocery items, rice, and other products in order to continue making sales and thereby ensure that her customers are getting everything they need.

loans.use: purchase beverages, sodas, groceries, rice, and other products.

loans.name: San Agustin Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Agustin está en su ciclo número 10 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. La Sra. Estela es una de las integrantes y se dedica a la confección y venta de sábanas, colchas y novedades artesanales. Es una persona muy luchadora y responsable.
La Sra. Estela solicita de este crédito para la compra de materiales para sus confecciones como ser telas e hilos, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group known as San Agustin is in the tenth lending cycle of its women's committee program, in which everyone works and helps each other get ahead. 

Estela is one of the members, and she earns her living making and selling sheets, comforters, and handcrafted novelty items. She is a very determined and responsible person. 

Estela is requesting this loan for the purchase of materials for her creations, such as fabric and thread. This will help her to realize her business plan, which will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread.

loans.name: Qurban

texts.en:
Qurban is 42 years old; he is married and the father of one son. He raises cows for milk purposes and has four years of experience in this field. His business brings him a stable income of 180 AZN. He has permanent buyers; however, there is only one problem he has now, which is the absence of water. Now, in order to water his cows, he has to herd them about 1 kilometer to the nearest river.

When he heard about water loans he was extremely excited and applied for a 1,800 AZN loan. A water channel is quite an expensive process which requires a labor force and special equipment. Qurban will use this loan to pay for special equipment rentals like a tractor for making a water channel and for workers who will dig up the land. He has a good loan history and this is his second loan. Qurban awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for special equipment rentals like a tractor for making a water channel.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es: Sarita, tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y aun no tiene hijos. Vive en la casa de su madre junto a su hermana. La actividad de Sarita consiste en la venta de bebidas bien heladas, de manera constante recibe en su casa al representante de la empresa distribuidora quien se encarga de anotar su pedido para que al día siguiente le envíen la cantidad solicitada de acuerdo a su capital, luego sencillamente los coloca en su congelador y espera la llegada de sus eventuales clientes que acuden a su local en busca de obtener la bebida más refrescante para calmar la sed. Trabaja sola por más de 2 años. Aunque su negocio le produce buenos ingresos económicos, siente que aún es poco para alcanzar a cubrir los principales gastos en su hogar. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/.800, está muy contenta al saber que tiene un respaldo económico para seguir avanzando en el cumplimiento de sus metas, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará progresivamente mayor cantidad de bebidas gasificadas al por mayor.
texts.en:
Sarita is 24 years old, is single with no children. She lives in her mother's house along with her sister. Sarita sells ice cold drinks. The representative of the distributing company comes to her house on a constant basis to take her order and on the following day sends the desired amount depending on her capital. Then she simply puts them into her freezer and waits for clients to come to her location to find the most refreshing drinks to quench their thirst. She has done this for more than two years. Although her business produces good results, she still feels that it is not enough to cover the principal household expenses.

Sarita is requesting 800 PEN with this loan which she will use to buy a progressively greater amount of soft drinks wholesale. She is pleased to know that she has this financial support in order to continue advancing toward her goals. She promises to pay her installments on time.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks wholesale.

loans.name: Perpetuo Socorro Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Perpetuo Socorro está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, trabajando todas ellas para poder salir adelante e ir creciendo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Romina,  quien es una persona muy trabajadora, que está luchando y esforzando cada día por salir adelante. Es manicurista  y por medio de su oficio está ayudando a familia y están saliendo adelante. Quiere seguir creciendo e invirtiendo en su trabajo, es por eso que solicita de este crédito, para poder invertirlo en la compra de esmaltes, algodón, alicates, corta uñas y demás productos para poder salir adelante. Agradece por esta ayuda que está recibiendo para poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
The Perpetuo Socorro [Perpetual Aid] group is in its first loan cycle with the committee program.  They are participating in the poverty elimination survey.  Three of them are below the poverty line, and all of them are working to get ahead and continue growing.

One member is Romina, a hardworking person who is fighting and making an effort every day to succeed.  She is a manicurist and through her work she's helping her family and they are getting ahead.  She wants to keep growing and investing in her work, so she is seeking this loan to invest in the purchase of nail polish, cotton, cuticle nippers, nail clippers, and everything else she needs.  She's grateful for the help she's getting to enable her to succeed.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, cotton, cuticle nippers, nail clippers, and other products.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Katupyry; está en su ciclo número  5  del programa de comité, donde todas y cada una de ellas están luchando por crecer y salir adelante con el esfuerzo que están haciendo. Ellas hacen la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder conocer la situación de cada una de ellas.
Zunilda es una de las miembros, quien con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo está saliendo adelante por medio de su trabajo. Ella vende empanadas, milanesas, asaditos, y bebidas también se debe destacar el esfuerzo que está poniendo por mejorar e ir creciendo.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de bebidas, gaseosas, jugos, carnes, huevos, para la elaboración de las comidas; entre otros; lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a seguir mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The “Kuña Katupyry” group is in cycle #5 in the committee program.  Each and every one of them is striving to grow and to get ahead by means of the effort they are making.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey to determine each of their situations.

Zunilda is one of the members who with much effort and sacrifice is getting ahead by means of her work.  She sells turnovers, breaded steak, grilled meat and beverages and the effort she’s putting into growing and improving should be pointed out.

She’s asking for this loan to buy beverages, soft-drinks, juices, meats and eggs, among others  to prepare the meals which will help her reach her business plan which in turn will help her to continue improving her income.

loans.use: to buy beverages, soft-drinks, juice, meat and eggs.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 27 years old from the town of Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. She is married with two children ages 5 and 8. For six years now, she has been farming vegetables like eggplant for an income. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy farm inputs like pesticides, seeds and a sprayer. 

She works hard for her children. She hopes that with her business profitability she can earn more income and provide for her children's education. She dreams of becoming more successful in farming for her family.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, seeds and a sprayer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and laborers' fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more crabs to resell

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana, de 40 años, está casada con Dedmer de 49 años y es padre de sus 02 menores hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Diana se dedica a la venta de comidas regionales. Todas las mañanas instala su mesa en el frontis de la casa de sus padres y pone a la venta todos los platos que prepara con mucho esmero, además también pone a la venta diversos refrescos elaborados con frutas típicas. Atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes quienes mayormente son sus propios vecinos y la recomiendan a otras personas que con el tiempo se vuelven sus clientes habituales. Se inició hace 3 años, inicialmente vendía poco pero con el paso del tiempo fue incrementando la cantidad de platos de acuerdo a la demanda de sus pedidos. Hasta el momento trabaja sola pero en ocasiones recibe el apoyo de su hermana. Comenta que le gusta su trabajo porque siempre sintió pasión por el arte culinario, además al ver las ganancias económicas que obtenía, no dudó en emprender este negocio y generar su propia fuente laboral. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Con el monto solicitado comprará ingredientes e insumos como arroz, orégano, huevos, pescados y otros productos que usa para la preparación de comidas regionales.
texts.en:
Diana, who is 40 years old, is married to Dedmer, who is 49 years old. He is the father of their two dependent children, who live with them in the house that they own. 

Diana earns her living selling regional foods. Every morning, she sets up her table in front of her parents' house and sells all the dishes that she has carefully prepared. She also sells various cold drinks made with local fruits. She serves her customers very courteously; the majority of them are her own neighbors. They recommend her to other people who then, with time, become regular customers. She began three years ago, initially selling very little, but with the passage of time she has gradually increased the quantity of servings in accordance with customer demand. So far, she has worked alone with the occasional help of her sister. She says that she likes her work because she has always been passionate about the culinary arts; after seeing the money she was earning, she felt no hesitation about establishing this business and generating her own source of employment. 

At this time, she is requesting 2,000 PEN. She is vary happy to know that she will have financial support, because now she feels sure of being able to continue to run her business. With the requested amount, she will buy ingredients and supplies like rice, oregano, eggs, fish, and other products that she uses to prepare her regional dishes.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies like rice, oregano, eggs, fish, and other products.

loans.name: Milka

texts.en: Milka is a hair dresser and a widow aged 38 years. She is also a mother of three. She has been in this business for 13 years and this is where she has got all the money to pay school fees for her children. She is applying for UGX 1,000,000 to buy more hair relaxing products and meet the demands of her clients. She hopes to pay back the loan within 6 months using the profits from the loan and also buy land to build a house for family with the next loan she hopes to get.

loans.use: to buy hair relaxers and gels.

loans.name: Esperanza Y Futuro  (Calceta) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Esperanza Y Futuro que se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta, ciudad conocida con el nombre de “Calceta la sin par”, por la belleza de sus mujeres y porque para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse tiempo atrás y formar este Banco Comunal que les ha servido de mucho para mejorar sus pequeños negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Erika, tiene 23 años de edad,  desde los 12 años  mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 4 hijos de 10, 9, 6  y 5 años que estudian en escuela. El marido es comerciante.

Doña Erika desde hace muchos años atrás aprendió belleza en una academia de la localidad, con estos conocimientos ella empezó a realizar trabajos de tinturado y cortes de cabello, tinturados que ella sabe hacer de una forma muy especial, razón por lo cual ella tiene muchos clientes que la buscan en su casa  o la  llaman para que les vaya a realizar estos trabajos a domicilio. Gracias a los créditos ha podido comprar varias herramientas que necesita para brindar un mejor servicio y es así como ha logrado mejorar su clientela por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar unas tenazas, una plancha de cabello, esmaltes y tintes materiales útiles para su trabajo. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que les brinda el banco. 

Su sueño es tener un gran salón de belleza.

La foto pequeña es de tres socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Banco Comunal Esperanza y Futuro [Hope and Future Communal Bank] group meets every fifteen days in the beautiful city of Calceta, known by the name “Calceta, a city without equal” due to the beauty of its women and because, for those who live there, there is no city more beautiful in the entire world.

This is a group of people who, some time ago, decided to meet and form this communal bank that has served them well to improve their small businesses. The members work in a variety of jobs such as retail, the service industry, and the sale of meals, among others.

One of the group members is Erika, who is 23 years old. Since the age of 12 she has been in a common-law relationship with a man. Together they have four children, ages 10, 9, 6, and 5, all of whom are school students. Her husband is a shopkeeper.

Some time ago, Erika learned cosmetology in a local academy. With those skills she began to work giving haircuts and dyes, using a special technique. Because of this, she has many clients who seek her out in her home or who call her in to their homes to work. Thanks to the loans, she has been able to buy various tools that she needs to offer improved service, and thus has managed to improve her clientele for the good of her family.

This loan is to buy a curling iron, straightening iron, nail polish, and hair dye--useful tools for her business. She has been part of the Communal Bank since its beginning and she likes it because of the help it provides.  Her dream is to own a great beauty salon.

The small photo is of three bank members who could not be present when they took the group photo.

loans.use: to buy a curling iron, a hair straightener, dye, and nail polish.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
l grupo llamado Mujeres Trabajadoras; está en su ciclo número  7  del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas está recibiendo capacitación y de esa forma ir mejorando sus vidas. También están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para poder conocer la situación de cada una de ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Zunilda, quien vende lencería de todo tipo, tanto para hombres como para mujeres. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que gracias al trabajo que viene haciendo puede ayudar a su familia y darles lo que necesitan para salir adelante y que no les falte nada.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de ropas interiores de hombres y mujeres y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Trabajadoras" group is in their seventh cycle with the Women Living in Poverty Program. They are receiving  training and in this way improving their lives. They are also participating in the Poverty Stoplight survey so each member can understand their own situation.

Zunilda is one member and she sells underwear of all sorts, for men as well as women. She is very hard-working. Thanks to this effort she can help support her family, give them what they need to get ahead and have everything they need. 

Zunilda is asking for this loan to buy men and woman's underwear to be able to continue with her business and satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy underwear to re-sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas está en su ciclo número 1 del programa, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde las 13 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, con ingresos muy bajos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mabel, quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, pero ella es consciente que trabajando es la única forma en la que podrá ir mejorando. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que es Empleada, y los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de prendas de variadas clases. Es una persona muy trabajadora que está luchando por ir mejorando cada día.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de prendas, como ser camisas, jeans, remeras y demás prendas lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) is in the program’s cycle #1 where they are all working and helping each other to get ahead.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey; 13 of the members are below the poverty line with very low income.

One of the members is Mabel who in the previous survey was at poverty level 1.  She’s aware that work is the only way by which she can start to improve.  She’s a very hardworking person who is striving to improve more every day.  She says that among the work she does is being an employee and on weekends she works selling all types of clothes.

She’s asking for this loan to buy clothes like shirts, jeans, t-shirts and other articles of clothing that will help her reach her business plan which in turn will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to buy shirts, jeans, t-shirts, etc.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en: Modesto is a 42 year old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has 5 children. The oldest is 16 while the youngest is 6. He engages in fishing. He catches and sells fish. Aside from fishing, Modesto is also into seaweed farming. He grows and sells seaweed, to augment more income. He requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy seaweed seedlings. In the future, Modesto would like to expand and manage it well to provide his children with quality education and improve his livelihood.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings.

loans.name: Riziki Group

texts.en:
Helena, who was born late 1970s, is married with four children, all of whom are in school. For twelves years now, Helena has been running a genge-duka business selling fruits and vegetables and sweets, maize flour, baking flour, soaps of different kinds, etc. She sells all of these items at the same shop.  Helena works from 6am to 10pm daily and is able to earn a small profit per month. 

This will be her 15th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Helena used her previous loans to restock more genge-duka items and has paid back all her previous loans successfully. With the profit earned, she has covered school fees, household expenses and bought a plot of land where she built a house. She  also added another room. Helena will use this loan to restock more on her genge-duka items (fruits, vegetables, sweets, maize flour, baking flour ,etc). Helena dreams that one day she will be in a position to do international business. 

Helena will share this loan with her loan group" riziki " which has 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock more on her genge-duka items (fruits, vegetable, sweets, maize flour, baking flour, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy building materials, such as cement and wood, for repairing her house

loans.name: Sumaiah

texts.en: Sumaiah is married with two children and one of her children goes to school. She has a boutique business and has been in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 UGX to buy more clothes and shoes. She works in a shop and sells to all categories of people but on retail basis only six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to own a fully stocked boutique and also to get enough profits so as to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Temurjon

texts.ru: Темурджону 20 лет. Он не женат и живет с родителями и 2 братьями. Темурджон отлично учился в школе и после окончания средней школы он поступил в Худжандский Государственный Университет в факультет Кибернетики. Темурджон имеет дополнительный доход от выращивания пшеницы и картошки, а также он занимается скотоводством. Темурджон должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Temurjon is 20 years old.  He is not married and lives with his parents and two brothers.  Temurjon studied excellently in school and was accepted to the Cybernetics department of the Tajikistan State University after graduating from school.  Temurjon has an additional income from growing wheat and potatoes and is also involved in animal husbandry.  Temurjon has to pay for his tuition contract, but does not have money.  He is requesting this loan to pay for his tuition.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a hardworking married woman with 2 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She operates a retail shop and with the proceeds she was able to build rental houses where she earns extra income. Customers not paying on time and price fluctuation are her major challenges while her vision to buy land and build a house. Margret intends to use the loan to buy beer and general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer and general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Dellita

texts.en:
Dellita is 28 years old from Jagna, Bohol. She is married with four children ages 1 to 8 years old. She has been in the business of raising hogs to help augment the income of her husband who works as a baker.
